Sentence: A public pension fund in Louisiana has sued the directors of Caremark Rx, contending that their unanimous backing of the company's $21 billion merger with CVS over a rival $26 billion bid from Express Scripts improperly benefits Caremark executives at the expense of shareholders.
Label: Main

Sentence: Among the benefits Caremark executives and directors will receive if the CVS deal goes through, the fund's lawsuit contends, are positions at the combined company and indemnification from penalties and fines that may result when criminal and regulatory investigations into possible stock option backdating by Caremark officials are concluded.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Yesterday, Express Scripts filed suit to block the CVS deal, arguing that the terms deal supported by the Caremark board prevents its directors from executing their fiduciary duties to shareholders.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The lawsuits, filed in Delaware Chancery Court, will once again bring the fiduciary duties of directors in the post-Enron world to the forefront.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: Delaware is where most major United States companies are incorporated.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Caremark accepted the CVS bid on Nov. 1, even though the stock-for-stock deal offered no premium to Caremark's market price at the time.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Caremark's directors have recommended that company shareholders approve the deal at a meeting that is expected to occur before March 16.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: On Monday, Caremark rejected the $26 billion bid made on Dec. 18 by Express Scripts, saying that it would ''result in a highly leveraged and weakened business'' if it was approved by shareholders.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The Express Scripts offer of $58.50 a share is approximately 15 percent higher than the CVS bid.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The lawsuit filed by the Louisiana Municipal Police Employees' Retirement System contends that the CVS deal is unfair to Caremark shareholders not only because its price is significantly below the rival bid.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: The pension fund's lawyers also argue that Caremark directors improperly accepted deal protection provisions in the CVS bid that act to deter other bidders, effectively making the deal a fait accompli even before the shareholders vote.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: First, there is the $675 million breakup fee to be paid by Caremark in cash to CVS, if the target walks away.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Then, there is a so-called last-look provision, which gives CVS the chance to come back and top any rival bid.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: ''Any potential third-party bidders will be loath to invest the time and resources necessary to pursue a superior bid while knowing full well that CVS retains control of the bidding,'' the pension fund's lawsuit says.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The Louisiana fund accuses the Caremark board of supporting the deal to benefit Edwin M. Crawford, the company's chief executive, and other executives.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Under the terms of the deal, nine Caremark executives will join the combined company and Mr. Crawford will become chairman of its board and receive an estimated $48 million in exit pay.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: While he would probably receive a similar amount if Caremark sold out to Express Scripts, Mr. Crawford might not be asked to join the combined company under the terms of such a deal.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The Louisiana pension fund also noted that the CVS deal guarantees a job at the merged company for Mr. Crawford's son, Andrew.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: A Caremark proxy filed last year described the younger Mr. Crawford as senior vice president for industry analysis and underwriting.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The merger with CVS would also allow an unspecified number of Caremark directors -- perhaps all of them -- to get lucrative seats on the combined company's board.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: In its offer, CVS has also agreed to cover any costs associated with stock option backdating at Caremark, practices that are under federal investigation and the subject of another civil suit filed against the company in Tennessee.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: That lawsuit has challenged 4.6 million options granted to Mr. Crawford as having been possibly backdated.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Stock sales covered by those options generated $262 million for Mr. Crawford, the Tennessee lawsuit contends.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: ''The inequities could not be more apparent,'' said Gerald H. Silk, a lawyer at Bernstein, Litowitz, Berger & Grossmann, one of the firms representing the Louisiana fund.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: ''Shareholders get a coercive, zero-premium deal while Crawford gets a $48 million payout, jobs for himself and his son and complete indemnification for his alleged option backdating transgressions.''
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: A Caremark spokesman called the pension fund's lawsuit meritless and said the company would defend against it vigorously.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: As for the Express Scripts suit, he said it was a ''frivolous'' attempt to interfere with the CVS merger.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: ''Contrary to allegations made by Express Scripts, the provisions of the CVS merger agreement are lawful and appropriate,'' the spokesman said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: To be sure, many of the terms in the CVS bid for Caremark -- the no-shop provisions and last-look opportunity -- are common in the merger world.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: But the suit filed in Delaware, comes at a time when directors' actions as fiduciaries for their shareholders are under increased scrutiny.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: As a result, the case, which is being heard by Chancellor William B. Chandler III, provides an opportunity for him to opine on the matter of directors' duties broadly and whether the Caremark directors exercised those obligations in particular.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: This is familiar territory for Chancellor Chandler, who oversaw the Disney case of 2005.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: In that case he chastised the company's directors for essentially rubberstamping a contract struck by Michael D. Eisner with Michael S. Ovitz that resulted in a $140 million severance payout after Mr. Ovitz was terminated a short time later.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Chancellor Chandler has asked for a hearing on the issues before Caremark's shareholders vote on the CVS bid, now scheduled to take place in mid-March.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: In a Dec. 29 meeting with the parties in the case, Chancellor Chandler said that while he was certain Caremark would argue forcefully that its directors exercised their duties of care and loyalty to the company's owners, he also concluded that ''there is a tenable argument on the other side, and nonfrivolous claims here on the other side, that at least need to be tested against a fuller record.''
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Crawford, would receive if a rival bid was accepted.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: If Express Scripts succeeds in its rival bid, Mr. Crawford would receive $57.6 million to $62.4 million, not an estimated $48 million.

Sentence: After two investors in Clear Channel -- Fidelity Investments and Highfields Capital Management, a hedge fund -- balked at the price, the two suitors, Bain Capital and Thomas H. Lee Partners, sent a letter to the Clear Channel board proposing alternatives to raise their offer.

Sentence: Stocks have been a great investment in the last 80 years, with an average return of about 10 percent a year.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: But have investors in the stock market done as well as stocks?
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Surprisingly, the answer is no.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The average dollar invested in the stock market in those years has earned only about 8.6 percent a year.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: The discrepancy between stock market return and investor return is examined by Ilia D. Dichev, a University of Michigan accounting professor, in a paper published in the March 2007 edition of The American Economic Review, ''What Are Stock Investors' Actual Historical Returns?
Label: Main

Sentence: Evidence From Dollar-Weighted Returns.''
Label: Main

Sentence: To understand the difference between a stock's return and an investor's return, consider someone who buys 100 shares of a company at a price of $10 a share.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: A year later, the share price is up to $20, and the investor buys 100 more shares.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Alas, the investor's luck has run out.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: By the end of the next year, the price has fallen back to $10 and the investor sells his 200 shares.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: A buy-and-hold investor who bought at $10, held the stock for two years, and then sold at $10 would have had a zero return.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: But our friend who tried to time the market did much worse: over the two years, he invested $3,000 in the stock and ended up with only $2,000.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: E
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: ven though the stock broke even, the investor lost money because of bad timing: most of his money was invested right before the market fell.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: To calculate a meaningful measure of the investor's return, it is necessary to weight the yearly returns by the dollars invested during that year.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: When Mr. Dichev calculates the dollar-weighted returns on this stock according to his preferred method, our hypothetical investor's average yearly return ends up being negative 16.8 percent, far below the zero return that the buy-and-hold investor would have received.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Some mutual fund families and reporting services currently report dollar-weighted returns for individual investors and funds.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Mr. Dichev's contribution is to apply this methodology to the stock market as a whole, weighting each month's return by the amount of money invested in the market during that period.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: An investor who bought a value-weighted portfolio of stocks in the New York Stock Exchange and American Stock Exchange in 1926 and held them until 2002 would have earned an average annual return of about 10 percent.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: By contrast, an individual who bought in 1926 but moved his dollars in and out of the market in the same pattern as the average dollar invested in the market would have earned a return of only 8.6 percent a year.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: For Nasdaq, the difference between buy-and-hold and dollar-weighted returns is even larger.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: An investor who bought the Nasdaq index in 1973 and sold in 2002 would have earned an average yearly return of 9.6 percent.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: But the typical investor in Nasdaq earned only 4.3 percent over this period.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: This is true not just in the United States -- the same thing occurred in 18 of 19 international markets that Mr. Dichev examined.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: It appears that taken as a whole, investors just aren't very good at market timing.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: But why?
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: There's an old adage on Wall Street: ''Buy on the rumor, sell on the news.''
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Unfortunately, small investors do not seem to follow this rule.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Terrance Odean, a finance professor at the University of California, Berkeley, has found that small individual investors tend to buy stocks when they are mentioned in the media: they buy on the news.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The professional and institutional investors are happy to sell to retail investors in such periods.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: A recent article in The Financial Analysts Journal by Thomas Arnold, John H. Earl Jr. and David S. North, all finance professors at the University of Richmond, called ''Are Cover Stories Effective Contrarian Indicators?''
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: offers an intriguing finding.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The professors look at how a company's stock responds to a cover story in BusinessWeek, Fortune and Forbes.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: They find that positive stories follow periods of positive performance and negative stories follow periods of negative performance, which admittedly is not too surprising.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: More interesting, they also find that the appearance of a cover story tends to signal the end of the abnormal performance.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Hence, individuals who trade on such ''news'' are not likely to do well.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: This is not to say that articles in the financial press are not worth reading.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Quite the contrary.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: They often provide insightful reporting and in-depth analysis.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: But by the time the articles have been researched, written and published, they are no longer news -- the market price of the stock already reflects the company's future prospects.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Taken together, this research offers yet more support for the time-tested investment strategy of buy and hold.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Anything that you think is news is old hat to the professionals.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Trying to outguess the market is a sucker's game.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Clear Channel Communications, the nation's largest radio broadcaster, said last night that its board had rejected a revised offer by two equity firms that had agreed to buy the company, but are now trying to keep the deal from falling through.
Label: Main

Sentence: The new offer was a last ditch attempt to save the deal from being voted down by shareholders next week, but now means the buyout is almost certain to be rejected.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Clear Channel said that the two firms -- Bain Capital Partners and Thomas H. Lee Partners -- had proposed increasing their bid from $39 a share to $39.20 and allowing shareholders to own a stake once the company goes private.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: That would allow shareholders to participate in any profit from a sale or initial offering in several years.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: The buyout firms had offered shareholders up to 30 percent of the company after it became private.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: The proposal came just days after Institutional Shareholder Services, the influential proxy advisory firm, recommended that shareholders reject the $39 a share bid, effectively killing the deal.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Before making the latest proposal, Bain and Thomas H. Lee consulted Highfields Capital Management, one of Clear Channel's biggest shareholders that had planned to vote against the deal, according to people involved in the talks.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Highfields had agreed to vote in favor of the deal, these people said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: But, Clear Channel said last night that in determining to reject the proposal, ''significant shareholders of the company have privately or publicly made known their opposition to the merger at $39 per share and their lack of interest in stub equity,'' referring to the stake that shareholders could have kept under the plan.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Stub equity was recently introduced to shareholders in the United States as a way to placate shareholders who had watched new owners of buyouts reap large profits by flipping the companies a few years later.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Just last month, shareholders of Harman International Industries, the maker of JBL speakers and Harman Kardon home theater systems, accepted a stub equity deal from buyout firms that included Kohlberg Kravis Roberts and Goldman Sachs.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Interestingly, Goldman Sachs is the adviser to Clear Channel that recommended the board reject the most recent proposal that also used stub equity.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Under the terms of the latest proposal, the buyout firms would have financed the 20 cent a share increase by having the Mays family, which founded Clear Channel, receive $37.60 a share, which was the price the company had originally accepted last November before the buyout firms raised their offer to $39 a share in a failed attempt to appease shareholders.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The Mays recused themselves in the vote over the new offer, Clear Channel said.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The shareholder vote is Tuesday.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Some investors are now expecting the company to pursue a recapitalization, and some shareholders could mount a proxy fight.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: IN the five years since the last farm bill was passed, the number of farmers' markets in this country has grown to nearly 4,500 from 2,750, gladdening the hearts of foodies who like nothing better than seeing locally grown Chioggia beets, butter radishes, Early Girl tomatoes, miniature pattypan squash, chervil, fresh goat cheese logs and duck breast in a conveniently located market.

Sentence: But a small slice of a much larger pie could amount to as much as or more money than farmers' markets now get from food-assistance programs.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: And the new money available for fruit and vegetables would mean that ''specialty crops'' -- the kind we actually think of as food, as opposed to crops like corn, soy and cotton that get the much criticized multibillion-dollar commodity subsidies -- would finally get support from the farm bill.

Sentence: More people would eat healthier diets, and farmers might start growing even better-tasting varieties, confident of finding a market.

Sentence: Many other programs proposed for the farm bill could bring locally grown food to places that want and need it, like schools and hospitals.

Sentence: But farmers' markets are where the bill can best serve cooks -- a frequently well-financed, always opinionated special-interest group that should start acting like one.

Sentence: Hedge funds have been very good to institutions like Yale.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: On its 2005 tax forms, the university reported annual income of $149 million from its hedge fund investments.

Sentence: And much of that income, which would have been taxable if derived from domestic hedge funds, was tax free because it was generated by offshore affiliates of such funds.

Sentence: That strategy of tax avoidance is one that many of the nation's wealthiest universities, as well as foundations and pension funds, have been using with great success.

Sentence: Now Congress is considering closing the loophole that allows it.
Label: Main

Sentence: The goal is to raise money for the Treasury.

Sentence: The Senate Permanent Subcommittee on Investigations, which has been looking into hedge fund practices, estimates that more than $100 billion in tax revenue a year is lost through the use of offshore tax havens and questionable tax shelters by investors of all types.

Sentence: ''A key concern is whether tax-exempt use of offshore corporations to invest in hedge funds is accelerating the shifting of U.S. assets offshore to avoid U.S. taxes,'' said Senator Carl Levin, the Michigan Democrat who heads the subcommittee and who is among the sponsors of legislation that would close a number of such loopholes.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: While nonprofit institutions are generally exempt from taxation, income produced by business activity that is deemed outside the scope of their mission may be subject to tax.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Under the tax code, profits from any activities financed with borrowed money, like much of the income from hedge fund and private equity investments, are taxable.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: But if the nonprofit invests in an offshore company, there is no tax.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: So hedge funds and private equity funds have set up offshore subsidiaries for nonprofits and other tax-exempt groups like pension funds to invest in.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: For instance, Farallon Capital Institutional Partners L.P. of San Francisco, a hedge fund in which Yale, the University of Michigan and other universities have invested, has a management company in the British Virgin Islands.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The offshore company was created in large part to help nonprofits avoid taxes, Thomas F. Steyer, Farallon's senior managing partner, wrote investors in a letter in 2000.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: A 2005 article in the newsletter Tax Notes said Duke University sought to keep 25 percent of its endowment, which now stands at $7.4 billion, invested in hedge funds.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: At the time, about 75 percent of Duke's hedge fund investments were in offshore funds, according to the article, written by Maximilian H. Haag, a Duke law student who had interviewed the university's investment managers.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: But universities do not generally disclose what portion of their endowment is invested in offshore hedge funds, and so it is impossible to estimate how much tax they are avoiding.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: And their officials are wary of discussing the issue.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Spokesmen for 10 of the nation's wealthiest universities either did not respond to a reporter's messages or declined to make anyone from their investment management teams available.

Sentence: ''As a matter of policy, we do not comment on our portfolio,'' Cass Ciatt, a spokeswoman for Princeton, wrote in an e-mail message.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: David Jarmul, a spokesman for Duke, emphasized the university's support for research, its financial aid programs and the other benefits its endowment provides.

Sentence: The university invests ''in various ways to maximize returns,'' Mr. Jarmul said by e-mail.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: ''Like other universities, Duke uses legitimate tax-advantaged structures, always in accordance with applicable law.''

Sentence: With growing signs of displeasure from Congress, however, there are indications that some universities are reconsidering the use of offshore entities as a tax-avoidance method.

Sentence: ''This practice is legal and has been approved by the Internal Revenue Service in a number of rulings,'' said Patrick Dunkley, senior counsel at Stanford University, whose endowment stood at $14.1 billion in 2006.

Sentence: ''We are nonetheless currently reviewing the investment strategy.''

Sentence: Congress made a pass at closing the loophole in 1993.

Sentence: ''I can tell you why I proposed it in one word: revenue,'' said former Representative Dan Rostenkowski, Democrat of Illinois, who was chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee from 1981 to 1994.

Sentence: ''That's the same thing driving them now.''

Sentence: Mr. Rostenkowski said that under ''pay as you go'' budget rules, which Congress adopted anew in January, ''you have to raise the revenue to feed this appetite we have for spending money.''

Sentence: In some cases, hedge fund investors can realize returns as high as 40 percent or more.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: So while closing the loophole could mean additional taxes for nonprofits, it would be unlikely to reduce their investments in hedge funds and private equity funds significantly, said Leon M. Metzger, a former hedge fund executive who teaches hedge fund management at New York University.

Sentence: ''Because returns are so very attractive, unless Congress takes an extreme approach, I don't think this will have a major impact,'' Mr. Metzger said.

Sentence: Richard Tofel, the Rockefeller Foundation's general counsel, said 21 percent of its $3.7 billion endowment was invested in hedge funds and 12 percent in private equity funds.

Sentence: He also said Rockefeller would be unlikely to end all its offshore investments if the law changed.

Sentence: ''Tax is part of what goes into the mix in making investment decisions,'' Mr. Tofel said, ''but on the other hand it's not the principal thing that drives investment decisions.

Sentence: You make judgments about underlying asset values, risk and reward, and taxes come in somewhere after that.''

Sentence: Shareholders of AMR, the parent company of American Airlines, rejected at the annual meeting on Wednesday two proposals aimed at setting controls on executive pay.
Label: Main

Sentence: The Allied Pilots Association had sponsored a resolution to give stockholders an advisory vote on executive compensation each year.

Sentence: A third proposal, to change the way votes for directors are cast, was rejected.

Sentence: It establishes a process by which owners of 10 percent of the company's outstanding common shares can call a special shareholder meeting.

Sentence: No person or investment group in AMR now meets this 10 percent threshold.

Sentence: The two-hour meeting was punctuated by wide-ranging comments from shareholders, investors and union representatives.

Sentence: Union members feel betrayed by such bonuses, said a spokesman, Bobby Gless.

Sentence: Last month, AMR announced an $81 million first-quarter profit.

Sentence: In 2006, the company earned $231 million.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: In his remarks to the shareholders, Mr. Arpey noted that this was the first time in six years that AMR had been profitable for four consecutive quarters.

Sentence: He said that the company had been ''scratching and clawing our way back up since 2002'' and had reached a point where it was no longer endeavoring to save itself.

Sentence: FRANKFURT (Reuters) - German conglomerate Thyssenkrupp (TKAG.DE) on Monday defended a landmark deal to split into two as concerns mounted over whether the plans, which will result in a 1 billion euro ($1.2 billion) tax hit, go far enough.
Label: Main

Sentence: Last week Thyssenkrupp said it would spin off its elevators, car parts and plant engineering units into a separate listed entity named Thyssenkrupp Industrials, while keeping steel and materials-related activities.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: In the first analyst call since the plans were announced, Thyssenkrupp Chief Executive Guido Kerkhoff, who was given a five-year contract on Sunday, said the new structure would reduce complexity and give shareholders a more transparent asset to invest in.
Label: Main

Sentence: Some analysts said however that Thyssenkrupp Industrials, while more focused, would still be a complex entity.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Ultimately, weve gone from one big conglomerate to two smaller conglomerates, Bank of America Merrill Lynch analyst Cedar Ekblom said during the call.
Label: Main

Sentence: TK Industrials has got three divisions, which are all capital goods businesses, but ultimately, are very different businesses with very different end-markets.
Label: Main

Sentence: Kerkhoff said, however, that the links between the divisions were significant.
Label: Main

Sentence: There is some glue between the three, he said.
Label: Main

Sentence: Theyre all depending on the same megatrends in the world.
Label: Main

Sentence: Theyre all depending on engineering and service competencies throughout the businesses.
Label: Main

Sentence: Shares in the company fell as much as 4.7 percent after the call.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: The corporate split came in response to years of shareholder pressure to simplify Thyssenkrupps sprawling conglomerate set-up.

Sentence: Analysts have pointed out that the group still needs a strategy for the business following the structural change.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The split bears similarity to E.ONs (EONGn.DE) spin-off of Uniper (UN01.DE), in which the German utility kept a minority stake which it said could be sold on the open market.

Sentence: It was ultimately acquired by Finnish peer Fortum (FORTUM.HE).

Sentence: In a similar vein, Thyssenkrupp, which will be renamed Thyssenkrupp Materials, will quickly move to sell the minority stake in Thyssenkrupp Industrials it will still hold after the spin-off is complete.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The sooner the better, Kerkhoff said, adding that Thyssenkrupp Materials would sell at the highest possible price as soon as the market could absorb it.

Sentence: The corporate split still requires shareholder approval, which is expected by early 2019.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Thyssenkrupp Materials is sustainable without the stake in Thyssenkrupp Industrials, Kerkhoff said.

Sentence: MINSK, Oct 8 (Reuters) - Belarus largest grocery retailer Eurotorg is set to become the countrys first company to list on an overseas stock market, as economic stability and a friendlier business environment allow non state-run enterprises to flourish.
Label: Main

Sentence: Eurotorg, which has a 19 percent market share and is five times larger than its closest domestic competitor, will file documents to Britains regulator needed to hold an initial public offering as early as this week.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The company, which last year became the first from Belarus to issue a Eurobond, expects to raise around $200 million in new money.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: A source familiar with the matter said the company was valued at up to $1.5 billion on a pre money basis, which does not take into consideration the capital the company will receive in the IPO.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Its an important step for Belarus, whose strongman President Alexander Lukashenko has, since a financial crisis in 2014-2015, loosened his grip on private enterprises and cut subsidies to state firms that have dominated since Soviet times.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Inflation is stable at a historic low of around 5 percent while the economy is growing at around 4.5 percent a year.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The economy probably hasnt been in a healthier state in the last 20 years, Eurotorg Chief Executive Andrei Zubkou told Reuters in an interview.

Sentence: Proceeds from the listing will be used to partially repay the companys foreign currency debt, and its core shareholders are expected to retain their majority shareholding.

Sentence: The supermarket chain will continue expanding by opening new stores in small towns and rural areas where Zubkou says it has practically no competitors.

Sentence: It has already launched 100 such shops.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: 1.8 million people live in small settlements.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: This is essentially a new market, said Zubkou.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Set up in the 1990s as a wholesaler, Eurotorg is the countrys largest private sector employer with around 40,000 workers.

Sentence: The IPO will give the company access to capital markets that are currently inaccessible to companies in Belarus
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: According to Zubkou, Belarusian retail resembles the market in neighbouring Poland, a European Union member, around a decade ago, meaning firms have room to grow.

Sentence: At the same time, Belarus protectionist policies have allowed companies to develop in the absence of international competition, he said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Any foreign company wanting to enter Belarus must comply with rules such as stocking a high proportion of Belarusian goods on store shelves.

Sentence: We see no potential for the arrival of powerful foreign players, Zubkou said.

Sentence: We have a feeling that Belarus as a whole, as a story, is louder and brighter today, Andrei Matsiavin, Eurotorgs Chief Strategy and Investment Officer, told Reuters.

Sentence: NEW YORK (Reuters) - Global equity markets fell on Monday amid unease over the impact of the U.S.-China trade war on Chinas growth, while the dollar gained against the euro as Italian bond yields spiked on a brewing spat over Italys budget plans.

Sentence: (Reuters) - Activist investor Daniel Loebs hedge fund Third Point LLC has demanded access to a trove of records from Campbell Soup Co, ranging from board meeting minutes to financial documents, as it ratchets up a campaign to replace the companys board of directors, according to a letter seen by Reuters.
Label: Main

Sentence: Third Points move offers an example of the legal tools shareholder activists are increasingly using to boost their chances of winning proxy contests against corporate boards.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Such maneuvering could prove crucial in this case, given Third Point, which owns 5.65 percent of the canned soup maker, faces challenges in wooing some key shareholders.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Descendants of former Campbell Soup Chairman John Dorrance own a combined 42 percent stake in the company, representing a major hurdle.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Third Point gave the U.S. company five days to provide it access to several, typically confidential, documents, pertaining to its recently completed strategic review, its mergers and acquisitions activity, and succession planning for its chief executive, according to Third Points demand letter, dated and delivered to Campbell Soup on Wednesday.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: In the letter, the hedge fund cites a New Jersey statute that gives shareholders the right to review company documents, provided they demonstrate a proper purpose for looking at the records.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: This sets the stage for a legal battle with Campbell Soup, should it refuse access to the records.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Campbell Soup, based in Camden, New Jersey, did not respond to a request for comment on how it would respond to Third Points demands.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: In a press release it published on Thursday to urge shareholders to back its board, the company said that it strongly objects to Third Points aggressive and short-sighted tactics.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: Third Point declined to comment.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Campbell Soup shares were up 1.2 percent at $36.94 in early morning trading in New York on Thursday, giving the company a market capitalization of $11.1 billion.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Last month, Third Point unveiled a slate of nominees to replace all twelve of Campbells directors, alleging the company has been mismanaged for years.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: The companys share price is now 30 percent lower than it was 20 years ago, Loeb said, adding that executives failed to explore all strategic options, including the sale of the company.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Campbell has disputed this, arguing that its recently concluded strategic review considered every possibility.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The company has said it currently plans to sell only its international and fresh refrigerated-foods units, as it focuses on improving its operational performance.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday that Jeff Dunn, the former president of Campbells fresh food unit, is leading a consortium of investors that is in talks to buy that division for between $500 million and $700 million.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: DECISIONS ON ACQUISITIONS
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Third Point said it needs to see Campbell documents to determine whether board directors or employees violated their fiduciary duty.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: In its letter, Third Point seized on comments made last month by Campbells interim CEO, Keith McLoughlin.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: McLoughlin, who took over when CEO Denise Morrison exited abruptly in May, had said the firm relied too much on acquisitions and lacked a culture of accountability, that led to poor execution.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: These admissions demonstrate that shareholders are entitled to the records of the companys decision-making processes to investigate this unquestionable mismanagement and further instances of wrongdoing, according to Third Points letter.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Among the things Loeb wants to find out is how the company went from saying that its $6 billion acquisition of Snyders-Lance would be accretive to earnings only to reverse itself and say it would be modestly dilutive to earnings.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: It is unfathomable that Campbell management could improperly represent to shareholders that the largest acquisition in the companys history would be accretive and just five months later admit that they blew it, the letter said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Third Point is also asking for details about what the board planned to do after Morrison stepped down, including hiring a headhunter and any information on potential CEO candidates.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Given Ms. Morrisons disastrous performance, the board should have been acutely focused on trying to identify a qualified replacement well before her separation, the letter said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Campbell, which revolutionized the home-cooking industry with easy-to-prepare soups and low-cost production techniques, has been struggling to attract young consumers to its namesake soups and Pepperidge Farm cookies.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: It is not clear if any company would buy Campbell in its entirety.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Kraft Heinz Co has considered an acquisition of Campbell in the past, sources have told Reuters, but there is no sign of any recent approach from the company.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: PLEDGED SHARES
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Third Points records request also covers any information related to board director Bennett Dorrance, who has held his seat since 1989 and was granted a waiver to stay after reaching the mandatory retirement age of 72.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Third Point is interested in finding out why Dorrance, a grandson of former company chief John Dorrance, has not moved more quickly to reduce the loans he took for which he pledged roughly $500 million of his Campbell shares as collateral.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Pledging or loaning out shares creates questions about whether the shares can be voted and if directors interests are truly aligned with those of shareholders, the letter said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Campbell said on Thursday it will hold its annual shareholder meeting, where investors will vote on the board directors, on Nov. 29.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: It is not clear whether any legal dispute over Third Points demand for company documents would be resolved by then.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Investors who hold Campbell shares as of Oct. 9 will be eligible to vote at the shareholder meeting, the company said.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: (Reuters) - Health insurer Aetna Inc AET.N said on Thursday it will sell its standalone Medicare prescription drug plan business to WellCare Health Plans Inc (WCG.N) as it seeks U.S. antitrust approval for a planned acquisition by CVS Health Corp (CVS.N).

Sentence: PARIS (Reuters) - French bank Natixis (CNAT.PA) said on Wednesday it planned to sell several specialized finance businesses to its parent, unlisted French cooperative lender BPCE, and use part of the 2.7 billion euros ($3.1 billion) in proceeds for acquisitions.
Label: Main

Sentence: This planned transaction would give Natixis further financial firepower to invest in its differentiating asset-light business lines  primarily asset management, Chief Executive Francois Riahi said in a statement.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Natixis said the deal would leave it with a war chest of 2.5 billion euros for acquisitions over the 2018-2020 period, up from 1 billion euros previously earmarked, although it currently has no specific new deals in the works.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The bank has already spent 400 million euros of that amount on two acquisitions earlier this year, its CEO said.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The French investment bank said it intends to pay shareholders a special dividend of 1.5 billion euros after the deal is closed during the first quarter next year if it doesnt find acquisition opportunities.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Natixis said the sale of assets will allow BPCE to widen the range of services it offers to its retail customers, while Natixis will beef up its profile as an investment bank.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Natixis will narrow its focus to asset management, wealth management, investment banking, payment services and insurance.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: It intends to make acquisitions in all those businesses, except for insurance.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: If Natixis were to identify acquisition targets after the special dividend is paid to shareholders, BPCE would back it with capital if needed, BPCEs Chief Executive Laurent Mignon said in a conference call with journalists.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Mignon, Natixis CEO until June, is also chairman of the investment banks supervisory board.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The assets to be sold to BPCE are consumer financing, factoring, leasing, sureties and guarantees, and securities services businesses.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Following the transaction, Natixis expects to raise its target for return on tangible equity in 2020 to between 14 percent and 15.5 percent from a previous target of between 13 percent and 14.5 percent.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The bank will also lift its core equity tier one ratio to 11 percent from 10.5 percent at the end of the second quarter as it will keep 500 million euros in capital.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: (Reuters) - Adobe Systems Inc on Thursday agreed to buy Marketo Inc for $4.75 billion from private equity firm Vista Equity Partners Management, adding heft to its cloud-based digital marketing business.
Label: Main

Sentence: The U.S. Photoshop maker is sharpening its focus on the fast-growing cloud business, a fiercely competitive market dominated by Microsoft Corp, Oracle Corp and Salesforce.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Marketos business-to-business marketing applications will complement Adobes digital marketing business, which provides cloud-based tools to help create, manage and analyze advertising and marketing campaigns, the companies said.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Marketo, started in 2006 as an email marketing service, was taken private by Vista for $1.8 billion in 2016.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The San Mateo, California-based company generated revenue of about $321 million in 2017, according to credit ratings agency Moodys Investors Service Inc.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The deal is expected to close in the fourth quarter of Adobes fiscal 2018 and Marketo Chief Executive Officer Steve Lucas will join the companys senior leadership team and continue to lead the Marketo team, Adobe said.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: After Vista acquired Marketo, it changed its management team, adding Lucas, a former SAP SE executive, as the CEO in 2016, who helped revive sales growth at the company.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Adobe has been on something of a shopping spree lately.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: In May it agreed to buy cloud-based e-commerce services provider Magento Commerce from private equity firm Permira for $1.68 billion.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Reuters had exclusively reported earlier this month that Adobe was in talks to buy Marketo.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: JP Morgan advised Adobe, while its legal adviser was Hogan Lovells.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Morgan Stanley and Kirkland & Ellis advised Marketo and Vista Equity Partners.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Adobe shares were up marginally in extended trading.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: NEW YORK/LONDON (Reuters) - China set a 10 percent tariff on U.S. liquefied natural gas (LNG) imports, extending a trade dispute into energy and casting a shadow over U.S. export terminals that would propel the United States into the worlds second-largest LNG seller.
Label: Main

Sentence: Beijing on Tuesday said it would tax U.S. products worth $60 billion effective Sept. 24 in retaliation for tariffs imposed by U.S. President Donald Trump in an escalating trade war.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The rate was smaller than the 25 percent tariff China had touted earlier, which offered some relief and helped shares in listed U.S. LNG companies climb.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The tariffs undermine Trumps drive to use U.S. shale oil and natural gas to turn the United States into a global energy leader.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The U.S. is on track to export over 1,000 billion cubic feet (bcf) of gas as LNG in 2018.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: One billion cubic feet is enough to fuel about 5 million U.S. homes for a day.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: But China, which purchased about 15 percent of all U.S. LNG shipped in 2017, is now on track to buy less than 100 bcf of U.S. LNG in 2018, less than last year, according to Thomson Reuters vessel tracking and U.S. Department of Energy data.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The country has taken delivery from just four vessels since June versus 17 during the first five months of the year.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Proposed U.S. export terminals, many expected to supply Chinese customers, were expected to account for 60 percent of all new LNG production coming to market by 2023, according to industry data.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: LNG, which involves super-cooling natural gas so it can be transported by ship rather than pipeline, has become one of the fastest growing commodity trades as nations seek cleaner fuels.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The tariffs extension to an energy commodity much in demand in China was a worrisome sign for trade relations and for billions of dollars in proposed U.S. terminals, said trade group executives.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Including LNG is a good indicator of how serious things have gotten between the U.S. and China on this trade issue, said Charlie Riedl, executive director of Center for Liquefied Natural Gas, a group whose members include Cheniere Energy, Chevron and Exxon Mobil.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: While we would like to see this resolved quickly, I dont see that happening right now, said Riedl, speaking by phone from a natural gas conference in Spain.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The longer the dispute lasts, the less likely proposed projects will find financial backers, he said.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Analysts say the tariffs will particularly hit plans by U.S. companies, such as Cheniere Energy (LNG.A), Sempra (SRE.N) and Kinder Morgan (KMI.N), to build new terminals or expand existing ones by adding processing units.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Some commercial agreements may be on hold until there is more visibility, said Stacey Morris, director of energy research at Alerian Indexes.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Cheniere, Kinder Morgan and Dominion Energy declined to comment.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: But the smaller-than-expected Chinese tariff helped lift Cheniere Energy, whose shares on Tuesday were up 2.9 percent, and Golar LNG (GLNG.O), whose stock rose 2 percent.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: China imported 1.6 million tonnes, or 11 percent, of the 14.9 million tonnes of LNG exported from the United States so far this year, according to Thomson Reuters data.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: That accounted for 5 percent of total Chinese LNG imports.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The U.S. has been looking to Europe to take on more of its natural gas as the China dispute continues.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Germany said on Tuesday the country would decide by year-end where to locate a new LNG receiving terminal as a gesture to the Trump administration.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Rockville, MD (Reuters) - Instagram on Monday said co-founders Kevin Systrom and Mike Krieger have resigned as chief executive officer and chief technical officer of the photo-sharing app owned by Facebook Inc, giving scant explanation for the move.
Label: Main

Sentence: The departures at Facebooks fastest-growing revenue generator come just months after the exit of Jan Koum, co-founder of Facebook-owned messaging app WhatsApp, leaving the social network without the developers behind two of its biggest services.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: They also come at a time when Facebooks core platform is under fire for how it safeguards customer data, as it defends against political efforts to spread false information, and as younger users increasingly prefer alternative ways to stay in touch with family and friends.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Concerns over Facebooks business sparked the biggest one-day wipeout in U.S. stock market history in July.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Systrom wrote in a blog post on Monday that he and Krieger planned to take time off and explore our curiosity and creativity again.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Their announcement came after increasingly frequent clashes with Facebook Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg over the direction of Instagram, Bloomberg reported.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: In a statement, Zuckerberg described the two as extraordinary product leaders.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Ive learned a lot working with them for the past six years and have really enjoyed it.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: I wish them all the best and Im looking forward to seeing what they build next, Zuckerberg said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: INDEPENDENCE
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Koums departure in May followed the exit of his WhatsApp co-founder Brian Acton.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: That led to a reshuffling of Facebooks executive ranks, increasing Zuckerbergs ability to influence day-to-day operations.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Zuckerberg ally Chris Cox, who leads product development for Facebooks main app, gained oversight of WhatsApp and Instagram, which had been given independence when Facebook bought them.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Adam Mosseri, who had overseen Facebooks news feed and spent a decade working closely with Zuckerberg, became Instagrams head of product.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Instagram and Facebook have operated independently and the two services barely mention each other.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: But as regulators have pushed Facebook to improve information safeguards for individual privacy, to combat addiction to social media, and to stop misinformation or fake news, Zuckerberg and other leaders have been under more pressure to monitor units beyond the core social network.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: ACQUISITION DONE RIGHT
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Systrom and Krieger notified the photo-sharing apps leadership team and Facebook on Monday about their decision to leave, Instagram said.
Label: Main

Sentence: Their departure would be soon, it said.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The New York Times first reported the move.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Systrom and Krieger met through Stanford University and worked separately in Silicon Valley before forming Instagram in 2010.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Facebook bought Instagram in 2012 for $1 billion.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The photo-sharing app has over 1 billion active monthly users and has grown by adding features such as messaging and short videos.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: In 2016, it added the ability to post slideshows that disappear in 24 hours, mimicking the stories feature of Snap Incs Snapchat.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The photo apps global revenue this year is likely to exceed $8 billion, showed data from advertising consultancy EMarketer.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Increased advertising on Instagram has seen the average price-per-ad across Facebooks apps decline this year after a year of upswing.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: A new privacy law in Europe also has affected prices.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Instagram had been hailed in Silicon Valley as a flashy acquisition done right, with the team kept relatively small and Systrom having the freedom to add features such as peer-to-peer messaging, video uploads and advertising.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: I see Mark [Zuckerberg] practice a tremendous amount of restraint in giving us the freedom to run, but the reason why I think he gives us the freedom to run is because when we run, it typically works, Systrom told Recode last June.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The apps latest product, IGTV, has been slow to gain traction.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Offered through Instagram and as a standalone app, IGTV serves up longer-length video content, mostly from popular Instagram users.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Video content has been a major emphasis for Facebook as it seeks to satisfy advertisers desire to stream more commercials online.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: TOKYO, Jan. 7 (Xinhua) -- The U.S. dollar changed hands in the mid-108 yen zone in early deals in Tokyo on Monday, largely in line with its levels in New York late last week.
Label: Main

Sentence: As markets opened here, the dollar was quoted 108.52-53 yen compared with 108.50-60 yen in New York and 107.84-86 yen at 5 p.m. on Friday in Tokyo.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The euro, meanwhile, fetched 1.1410-1410 dollars and 123.81-82 yen against 1.1392-1402 dollars and 123.62-72 yen in New York and 1.1407-1409 dollars and 123.02-06 yen in late Friday afternoon trade in Tokyo.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: TOKYO, Jan. 4 (Xinhua) -- Tokyo stocks closed sharply lower Friday, with the benchmark Nikkei stock index dropping over 2 percent, as investors offloaded issues following an overnight rout on Wall Street, triggered by concerns over the outlook for the global economy.
Label: Main

Sentence: The 225-issue Nikkei Stock Average dropped 452.81 points, or 2.26 percent, from last Friday to close the day at 19,561.96.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: The broader Topix index of all First Section issues on the Tokyo Stock Exchange, meanwhile, lost 22.93 points, or 1.53 percent, to finish at 1,471.16.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Precision instrument, electric appliance and machinery-linked issues comprised those that declined the most by the close of play on the first trading day of the week.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Markets here were closed from Monday to Thursday for holidays.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: BEIJING, Dec. 24 (Xinhua) -- China will lower or remove import and export duties on a number of items starting 2019 as part of a tariff adjustment package announced Monday as the country further opens up the economy.
Label: Main

Sentence: To expand imports, more than 700 items of products will be subjected to temporary import tariff rates starting Jan. 1, with the duties on the raw materials for some medicines removed, the Ministry of Finance said in an online statement.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Tariffs on some fur imports will be reduced while relatively low temporary import tariff rates will continue to be imposed on much-needed advanced equipment such as aircraft engines as well as resource products such as natural feeds, the ministry said.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Export tariffs on products including chemical fertilizers and iron ore will be scrapped, it said.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: China will also apply conventional tariffs on products from 23 countries and regions, including further reduction in tariffs under free trade pacts between China and relevant countries, the ministry said.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: This will result in lower tariffs with trade partners including New Zealand, Peru, Costa Rica, among others.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The move aims to support the Belt and Road Initiative and the development of free trade areas, speed up China's economic and trade cooperation with relevant countries, and create a favorable external condition for the healthy and stable development of the economy in the long term, the ministry said.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Imported goods from China's Hong Kong and Macao into the Chinese mainland will enjoy zero tariffs under relevant pacts on goods trade.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The preferential tariff rates with Bangladesh and Laos under the Asia-Pacific Trade Agreement will be adjusted along with a reduction in the most-favored-nation (MFN) tariff rates.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: China will also reduce the MFN rates for 298 items of information technology products from July 1, 2019, the ministry said.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: In a bid to open its economy wider to the world, China lowered tariffs on an array of products from medicines to vehicles in 2018, with the general duty level down from 9.8 percent to 7.5 percent.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: SINGAPORE, Dec. 24 (Xinhua) -- Singapore's Consumer Price Index (CPI) grew 0.3 percent year on year in November, following the 0.7 percent increase in October, said the Ministry of Trade and Industry (MTI) and the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) in a joint release on Monday.
Label: Main

Sentence: The MAS Core Inflation, which excludes the costs of accommodation and private road transport, declined from 1.9 percent on a year-on-year basis in October to 1.7 percent in November.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The authorities said the CPI decline was largely due to a sharper fall in private road transport costs, and to a lesser extent, smaller increases in the prices of services, retail items and electricity and gas, which more than offset a slower pace of decline in accommodation costs.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: As for the MAS Core Inflation, they attributed the decline to a smaller increases in the costs of services, retail items and electricity and gas.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The MTI and MAS reiterated their forecasts, saying the city-state will see the MAS Core Inflation rise modestly in the months ahead, and come in within the forecast range of 1.5-2 percent in 2018 and 1.5-2.5 percent in 2019.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The CPI is projected to grow by about 0.5 percent in 2018, before rising to 1-2 percent in 2019, they added.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: CHICAGO, Jan. 5 (Xinhua) -- Chicago Board of Trade (CBOT) agricultural futures closed sharply higher in the first week of 2019, boosted by dry weather impacting Brazilian crops and news about upcoming trade talks between China and the United States.
Label: Main

Sentence: For the trading week which ended Jan. 4, the most active corn contract for March delivery was up 7.5 cents weekly, or 2 percent, to 3.83 dollars per bushel.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: March wheat rose 5.2 cents, or 1.08 percent, to 5.17 dollars per bushel.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: March soybeans rallied 26 cents, or 2.9 percent, to 9.215 dollars per bushel.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: At the end of 2018, Chinese and U.S. heads of state stressed during a telephone conversation the latest progress in trade talks, voicing hope for further results that can bring benefits to both sides and the world.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Entering new year, CBOT agricultural futures, soybeans in particular, were further uplifted by official confirmation that China and the United States would hold vice ministerial level trade consultations on January 7 and 8 in Beijing.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: China has been the world's top soybean buyer.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Any positive development concerning the trade talks between the two sides will naturally boost U.S. soybean prices.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Adverse weather conditions in South America have also supported CBOT futures, especially soybean and corn prices, as dryness is expected to hit more than a third of Brazil's crop areas this month.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Brazil is another leading soybean grower in the world.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: As a result of the weather factor, combined with China trade hopes, the U.S. soybean futures posted nearly 3 percent gains this week.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: However, a partial shutdown of the U.S. federal government has made it difficult for CBOT traders to follow official export data, as the Department of Agriculture (USDA) has not updated its export sales reports since Dec. 21, 2018.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Traders now have to learn from other channels about new overseas purchases of U.S. soybeans and other agricultural commodities.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: CBOT wheat, which recorded a 18 percent annul rise in 2018, started the new year further higher, in step with a rally in European market.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: World wheat prices have increased amid concerns over declining Argentine grain quality and tightening supplies from Russia and Black Sea area.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Following recently reported export sales to Egypt, U.S. wheat might be in a position to take larger market share, with the help of a softer dollar, said analysts.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Along with likely shrinking U.S. winter wheat seeding acres, AgResource, a Chicago-based Agricultural research firm, now maintains a bullish outlook into spring with an initial target of 5.50 dollars per bushel for March delivery.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Meanwhile, the corn market's upside potential is also in focus, said AgResource, given the unfavorable weather conditions in South America.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: BEIJING, Jan. 4 (Xinhua) -- China's treasury bond futures closed lower on Friday, with the contract for settlement in March 2019 closing 0.07 percent lower at 99.52 yuan (about 14.5 U.S. dollars).
Label: Main

Sentence: The contract for settlement in June 2019 closed 0.05 percent lower at 99.5 yuan.
Label: Main

Sentence: The contract for settlement in September 2019 closed 0.79 percent lower at 98.76 yuan.
Label: Main

Sentence: The contracts are agreements to buy or sell treasury bonds at a predetermined price on a set date.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: They allow investors to bet on and profit from the movements in the value of the bonds.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The treasury bond futures were launched at the Shanghai-based China Financial Futures Exchange and started trading on Sept. 6, 2013.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: BEIJING, Nov. 28 (Xinhua) -- Chinese President Xi Jinping's signed article titled "Joining Hands for New Splendor in the New Era" published Tuesday on Spanish newspaper ABC ahead of his visit has drawn warm responses in the European country, raising high expectations for more vigorous development of the China-Spain relations.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Spanish media and scholars hail the visit as a new historic development opportunity, and believe that the Chinese president has charted the course in his signed article for development of the two countries' relations.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: "China sees in Spain a good partner along the course of development, and China hopes to bring out the best the two economies could offer each other and make good use of existing cooperation mechanisms," Xi said in the article.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: "We need to synergize the Belt and Road Initiative and Spain's 'Strategic Vision for Spain in Asia' and the 'Mediterranean Corridor', and actively explore cooperation in third markets for win-win cooperation in broader areas," he said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Spain's most read newspaper El Pais wrote that during the first state visit to Spain by a Chinese president in 13 years, the two countries seek for closer bilateral ties in various fields such as politics, economy and culture.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The upcoming signing of a series of bilateral economic and trade agreements will boost exports of Spain's agricultural products into the Chinese market, and create favorable conditions for the two countries to explore cooperation in third markets, said El Pais.
Label: Main

Sentence: The Belt and Road Initiative provides plenty of opportunities for cooperation between the Chinese and Spanish companies, and the Chinese president's visit will drive more Spanish products like grapes and pork products into the Chinese market, Spanish Minister for Industry, Commerce and Tourism Reyes Maroto was quoted as saying by Expansion, a key economic newspaper in Spain.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: ABC also published articles regarding Xi's visit, saying that President Xi's visit to Spain will open up a new page for bilateral relations and the enhancement of mutual understanding, and the Belt and Road Initiative has rejuvenated the ancient commercial road, from which Spain should not detach itself.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Spanish newspaper El Confidencial expects that President Xi's visit could yield more concrete fruits in bilateral cooperation, so that the Spanish public could feel the positive influences brought by the results.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Alberto Rubio, director of Spanish newspaper The Diplomat, said that undoubtedly China is a partner of great significance for Spain, adding that there is huge potential for bilateral cooperation, and there are still many fields to explore in this relationship.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Xi also said in the article that a major task of the trip this time "is to engage with leaders of host countries and major economies in discussions on ways to enhance unity among the international community, improve global governance, develop partnerships, and deepen friendship and cooperation for peace, stability, development and prosperity of the world."
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Xulio Rios, director of Spain's Observatory of Chinese Politics, said Xi's article is of huge realistic significance and noble ambitions.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Xi quoted Spanish philosopher Jose Ortega Gasset in his article as saying that "one can only make progress when he thinks big, and move forward when he looks far."
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Rios said Xi's quotes aim to remind us that the China-Spain relationship not only has a long history, but also boasts huge potentials for healthy development, and that both countries should seize the valuable opportunity to deepen bilateral ties.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Jose Luis Barcelo, director of Spanish online newspaper El Mundo Financiero, said the world looks forward to knowing more about China and Xi's trip has offered more opportunities for China to establish political, commercial and cultural relations with the rest of the world, and has opened a window of hope to create a multipolar world on the basis of equality and mutual benefit.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: NEW YORK, Dec. 3 (Xinhua) -- Qatar's announcement Monday to withdraw from the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) sparked investors' concerns over a more volatile policy-making in the global oil market, amid persistent fears of oversupply and shrinking demand shown in constant price slides over the last two months.
Label: Main

Sentence: "The high volatility and large down move of the last 60 days will have a lasting impact on trading going into first quarter of 2019," said Albert Helmig, CEO of Grey House, a private consulting firm focused on market structure, risk management and price models.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: CONCERNS BUILD UP
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Qatar's decision to end its 57-year membership in the oil cartel on Jan. 1, 2019 came three days ahead of a meeting between the Saudi-led OPEC and its allies to reshape global oil policy to grapple with broad price drops.
Label: Main

Sentence: Qatar's Minister of Energy Saad al-Kaabi told press that Doha would still attend OPEC's upcoming meeting on Thursday and Friday in Vienna.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: "We are not saying we are going to get out of the oil business, but it is controlled by an organization managed by a country," said al-Kaabi.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Al-Kaabi added that it would not be practical for Doha to "put effort and resources and time in an organization" in which Qatar was "a very small player, and didn't have a real say in what happens."
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The decision "does come at a time when OPEC needs to hammer out a deal in the face of market skepticism in the cartel's ability to control production," said Ann-Louise Hittle, head of Macro Oils at Wood Mackenzie, an Edinburgh-based global energy research and consultancy firm, in a press release.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Hittle also pointed out that as the smaller nations of OPEC have a relatively passive role in the group's decision-making, "Qatar may also see that it has less to gain from its membership."
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The move exposed the deepening rift between Qatar and its Gulf neighbors since June 2017, when Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates and others severed diplomatic ties with Qatar.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Doha's quitting OPEC consequently gave rise to concerns that Saudi Arabia, Russia and the United States, the world's top three oil producers, would gain more control over global oil policy-making, as geopolitics has been one of the main drivers behind oil prices.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Russia has recently shown its willingness to cooperate with OPEC in a potential oil output cut in the face of U.S. calls for a further pullback in oil prices.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Investors had worried that Saudi Arabia would avoid confronting the United States over oil prices.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: "Prior OPEC-Russian efforts to cut production were effective for as long as a year, but ultimately the result is loss of market share to the United States and a return to low prices," said Chris Low, chief economist at U.S. securities broker firm FTN Financial, in a note to media.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Helmig said that despite investors' anticipation of an OPEC announcement of a production cut, the market has been very cautious and "awaiting more details of size and timing of a production change."
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: BIGGEST LNG PRODUCER
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: BERLIN, Nov. 29 (Xinhua) -- German investigators have raided the offices of Deutsche Bank on Thursday as part of a probe into potential money-laundering activities by the Frankfurt-based lender.
Label: Main

Sentence: Around 170 state prosecution officers, federal criminal police officers and tax investigation officers participated in the searches at six premises associated with Deutsche Bank in and around Frankfurt.
Label: Main

Sentence: A spokesperson for the local state prosecution office confirmed that the raid was prompted by suspected money laundering offenses which were identified in the wake of the so-called "Offshore-Leaks" and "Panama Papers" scandals.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Two Deutsche Bank employees, as well as "other not yet identified culprits" are believed to have assisted customers in establishing shell corporations in tax havens and subsequently transferring funds derived through crime onto German accounts of the bank.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: An entity associated with DAX-listed institute in the British Virgin Islands is believed to have assisted more than 900 customers in such transactions with a volume of 311 million euros (353 million U.S. dollars) since 2016 alone.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The offshore activity in question was not flagged to government authorities as being suspicious.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: As a consequence, the suspects are accused by prosecutors of having neglected their fiduciary duty to report on potential money laundering offenses although there was sufficient evidence to suggest criminal behavior on behalf of clients.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Deutsche Bank, Germany's largest financial institute, has posted heavy losses during past years as a spat of legal scandals and falling investment banking revenue weighed on its earnings.

Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: We will cooperate with the authorities fully", a statement by the bank read.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: NAIROBI, Nov. 21 (Xinhua) -- The African Development Bank (AfDB) said Wednesday it has approved two loans worth 27.5 billion shillings (about 268 million U.S. dollars) for the completion of construction work on Thwake dam on Thwake River in southern Kenya.
