Sentence: At the end of the day, deep warm water, what we call ocean heat content, thats really the fuel supply for these storms, said J. Marshall Shepherd, director of the atmospheric sciences program at the University of Georgia.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: PANAMA CITY BEACH, Fla. (Reuters) - A week after Hurricane Michael battered Floridas Gulf Coast with record fury, the full extent of devastation and loss of life remained unclear on Wednesday, as disruptions to phone, power and transportation systems hindered the disaster recovery.
Label: Main

Sentence: At least 30 people were killed, according to local authorities, when Michael plowed ashore as one of the fiercest hurricanes on record to strike the U.S. mainland, pulverizing a cluster of seaside towns along Floridas northwestern Panhandle region.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Seven days later search crews continued combing through the wreckage of demolished neighborhoods looking for any sign of additional victims in Panama City Beach, Mexico Beach and Port St. Joe, the communities closest to the storms landfall.
Label: Main

Sentence: Distribution of food and water to storm-stricken residents farther inland has been slowed by communication outages and storm-shattered roads blocked by toppled trees, power lines and other debris.
Label: Main

Sentence: Florida officials have not said how many people may be missing.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Teams of volunteers with the Houston-based CrowdSource Rescue organization were trying to reach more than 700 Florida residents reported unaccounted for by worried relatives and friends, said Matthew Marchetti, the organizations co-founder.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Most of that number, down from 2,100 people the group was trying to locate in the immediate aftermath of the storm, are from Panama City and many of them are elderly, disabled, impoverished or living alone, Marchetti said.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: He said the search had been hampered by spotty cell phone service in the devastated area, though authorities were making progress in restoring communications.
Label: Main

Sentence: High volumes of missing persons reports are not uncommon in the days following a natural disaster because so many survivors fail to check in with loved ones right away or lack the means to do so because of phone and power outages, authorities said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Nevertheless, at least 48,000 Florida residents in the 12 counties hardest hit by Hurricane Michael had registered for disaster assistance as of Wednesday with the Federal Emergency Management Agency, FEMA spokesman Ruben Brown told Reuters.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: That number represents about 7 percent of the population of the 12 counties designated by President Donald Trumps federal disaster declaration as eligible for FEMA aid to individuals and households.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Nearly a third, or more than 15,000 people, reported storm damage to their homes when they signed up with FEMA, though the full scope of property losses remained to be seen, Brown said.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: As of Wednesday, 286 families left homeless by the storm in Bay County, at the epicenter of the disaster, were approved for FEMA-furnished hotel vouchers, he said.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Florida accounted for 20 of the known fatalities attributed to Hurricane Michael, with six more in Virginia, three in North Carolina and one in Georgia, according to a Reuters tally of reports from county officials along the path of the storm.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Officials said medical examiners were determining whether another four deaths in Florida were storm-related.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: As of Tuesday, FEMA had distributed about 4.5 million meals, more than 5 million liters of water and 9 million infant-and-toddler kits, Brown said.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The state government was distributing ice, water and about 3 million ready-to-eat meals, Governor Rick Scotts office said.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Nearly 155,000 homes and businesses remained without power in the U.S. Southeast, with residents of battered coastal towns forced to cook on fires and barbecue grills.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: At least 70 percent of customers in four mainly rural Florida Panhandle counties were without electricity on Wednesday.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: On Tuesday, the federal government said that 61.5 percent of cell sites remained out of service in Bay County.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Officials said it could be weeks before power returns to some.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Countless numbers of people in the regions backcountry have struggled for days without running water or sanitation, awaiting help from authorities.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Some have been camping in tents with the belongings they were able to salvage.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: NEW YORK (Reuters) - Stocks in weather-sensitive industries reacted as Hurricane Florence moved closer to the U.S. East Coast on Monday.
Label: Main

Sentence: Shares of roofing and insulation products companies including Beacon Roofing Supply Inc (BECN.O) and Owens Corning (OC.N) rose, while insurers such as Allstate Corp (ALL.N) tumbled.
Label: Main

Sentence: Florence, the first major hurricane to threaten the eastern United States this year, was forecast to hit the coast of North Carolina or South Carolina on Thursday.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: North Carolina ordered residents to evacuate the states Outer Banks barrier islands, and the governors of Virginia, North Carolina and South Carolina declared states of emergency.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The Atlantic hurricane season, which typically runs from June to November, caused more than $250 billion worth of damage in the United States in 2017.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: But several industries benefited.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Car rental and hotel companies saw an influx of customers, while freight companies commanded higher prices as capacity tightened due to increased demand for supplies in areas struck by hurricanes.
Label: Main

Sentence: Here is a summary of how shares are performing as Hurricane Florence approaches:
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: BUILDING SUPPLIES
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Hurricane Florence had a mixed effect on building products companies.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Shares of roofing and insulation companies climbed, while those of cement companies fell.
Label: Main

Sentence: On Monday, shares of Beacon Roofing rose 8.2 percent, their biggest one-day percentage jump in more than a year.
Label: Main

Sentence: Owens Corning shares rose 3.7 percent and were the top gainers on the PHLX Housing Index .HGX.
Label: Main

Sentence: Shares of generator maker Generac Holdings Inc (GNRC.N) also touched a four-year high and were last up 5.6 percent.
Label: Main

Sentence: But Summit Materials Inc (SUM.N) shares fell 8.1 percent after the cement and concrete supplier warned of adverse weather, including Hurricane Florence, hurting performance in several of its markets.
Label: Main

Sentence: The shares of peer companies Martin Marietta Materials Inc (MLM.N), Vulcan Materials Co (VMC.N) and Eagle Materials Inc (EXP.N) also declined between 2 percent and 3.5 percent.
Label: Main

Sentence: HOME IMPROVEMENT
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Shares of Lowes Companies Inc (LOW.N) and Home Depot hit record highs on Monday.
Label: Main

Sentence: Lowes shares were last trading 2.2 percent higher, while Home Depot shares were up 2.6 percent.
Label: Main

Sentence: During the 2017 Atlantic hurricane season, Home Depot shares rose 16.3 percent.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: But Lowes shares only rose 4.7 percent during that period, lagging the S&P 500, as the chain struggled to compete with Home Depot.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: INSURANCE
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Allstate shares fell 1.9 percent on Monday.
Label: Main

Sentence: The insurer had a 10.5 percent market share in South Carolina and a 6.6 percent market share in North Carolina, according to Sandler ONeill.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Shares of Travelers Companies Inc (TRV.N), Progressive Corp (PGR.N) and American International Group Inc (AIG.N) declined between 1 percent and 2 percent.
Label: Main

Sentence: CAR RENTAL
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Shares of Hertz Global Holdings Inc (HTZ.N) and Avis Budget Group Inc (CAR.O) surged during much of the 2017 Atlantic hurricane season on investors anticipation of increased demand.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Hertz shares climbed 156.2 percent between June and early November, while Avis shares rose 80.1 percent.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: On Monday, Hertz shares rose 4.4 percent and Avis shares added 2.7 percent.
Label: Main

Sentence: FREIGHT
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: In 2017 between June 1 and Dec. 1, shares of USA Truck Inc (USAK.O) soared 172.9 percent, while shares of XPO Logistics Inc (XPO.N) and Old Dominion Freight Line Inc (ODFL.O) climbed more than 40 percent.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: J B Hunt Transport Services (JBHT.O) shares rose 26.7 percent over the same period.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: On Monday, XPO Logistics shares rose 5.4 percent.
Label: Main

Sentence: USA Truck shares advanced 3.8 percent, J B Hunt gained 3.7 percent and Old Dominion added 1.6 percent.
Label: Main

Sentence: HOTELS
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Shares of hotel operators were little changed on Monday.
Label: Main

Sentence: They had gained during the 2017 hurricane season as demand from guests displaced by hurricanes outweighed the hit from storm damage.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: From June 1 to Dec. 1, 2017, shares of Hyatt Hotels Corp (H.N) jumped 25.8 percent.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Shares of Marriott International Inc (MAR.O), Hilton Worldwide Holdings Inc (HLT.N) and Choice Hotels International Inc (CHH.N) rose up to 18.9 percent.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: PANAMA CITY, Fla. (Reuters) - Hurricane Michael, the fiercest storm to hit Florida in 80 years and the third-most powerful ever to strike the U.S. mainland, battered the states Gulf coast with roof-shredding winds, raging surf and torrential rains before turning its diminishing fury on Georgia.
Label: Main

Sentence: Michael, whose rapid intensification as it churned north over the Gulf of Mexico caught many by surprise, made landfall on Wednesday afternoon near Mexico Beach, about 20 miles (32 km) southeast of Panama City in Floridas Panhandle region, with top sustained winds reaching 155 miles per hour (249 kph).
Label: Main

Sentence: The storm came ashore as a Category 4 hurricane on the five-step Saffir-Simpson wind scale, the biggest storm on record to strike the Florida Panhandle.
Label: Main

Sentence: Its sustained winds were just 2 mph (3.2 kph) shy of an extremely rare Category 5.
Label: Main

Sentence: The storms intensity waned steadily as it pushed inland and curled northeasterly into Georgia after dark.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: It was downgraded to a Category 1 storm, with top sustained winds diminishing to 75 miles per hour (120 kph), about nine hours after it made landfall.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The governors of North and South Carolina urged residents to brace for more heavy rain and storm-force winds as Michael plows northward up the Atlantic seaboard.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The Carolinas are still reeling from severe flooding in the aftermath of Hurricane Florence less than a month ago.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The National Hurricane Center said Michael would pass through the Carolinas as a tropical storm on Thursday, dumping as much as 8 inches of rain in some areas.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Up to a foot (30 cm) of rain was forecast in Florida.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Gadsden County sheriffs spokeswoman Anglie Hightower said a male subject was killed by a tree toppling onto his house in Greensboro, Florida, near the state capital, Tallahassee, in the first report of a fatality from the hurricane.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: Severe flooding, heavily damaged buildings, uprooted trees and downed power lines appeared widespread in coastal areas near the storms landfall.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: Television news footage during the day showed many homes submerged in floodwaters up to their roofs in Mexico Beach, where the fate of about 280 residents who authorities said defied evacuation orders was unknown.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: Numerous buildings in Panama City were demolished, partially collapsed or without roofs amid deserted streets littered with debris, twisted, fallen tree trunks and dangling wires.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: Authorities said the full extent of devastation would not be known until after daybreak on Thursday.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: In the meantime, curfews were imposed across much of the region.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: Bill Manning, a 63-year-old grocery clerk, fled his camper van in Panama City for safer quarters in a hotel only to see the electricity there go out.
Label: Distant_Anecdotal

Sentence: My God, its scary.
Label: Distant_Anecdotal

Sentence: I didnt expect all this, he said.
Label: Distant_Anecdotal

Sentence: Without power, the city was plunged into darkness at nightfall and its flooded streets were mostly silent and devoid of people or traffic.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: By Wednesday night, more than 403,000 homes and businesses were without electricity in Florida, Georgia and Alabama, utility companies said.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: ALMOST IMPOSSIBLE
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Twenty miles south of Mexico Beach, floodwaters were more than 7-1/2 feet (2.3 meters) deep near Apalachicola, a town of about 2,300 residents, hurricane center chief Ken Graham said.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: Wind damage was also evident.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: There are so many downed power lines and trees that its almost impossible to get through the city, Apalachicola Mayor Van Johnson said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) said on Tuesday an estimated 500,000 Florida residents had been ordered or urged to seek higher ground before the storm in 20 counties spanning a 200-mile (320-km) stretch of shoreline.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: But Brad Kieserman of the American Red Cross said on Wednesday as many as 320,000 people on Floridas Gulf Coast had disregarded evacuation notices.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: An estimated 6,000 evacuees took cover in emergency shelters, most of them in Florida, and that number was expected to swell to 20,000 across five states by weeks end, Kieserman said.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Bo Patterson, the mayor of Port St. Joe, just south of Mexico Beach, rode out the storm in his house seven blocks from the beach, describing the scene outside as very, very scary.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: He was one of about 2,500 of the towns 3,500 residents who ended up staying put, many of them caught off guard by the storms rapid escalation as it approached.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: This happened so quickly, he said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: FEMA head Brock Long acknowledged that early evacuation efforts in the area were slow in comparison to how quickly the hurricane intensified.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Michael grew from a tropical storm into a Category 4 hurricane over the course of about 40 hours.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Satellite images of Michaels evolution on Tuesday night were, in a word, jaw-dropping, wrote Bob Henson, a meteorologist with weather site Weather Underground.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: With a low barometric pressure recorded at 919 millibars, the measure of a hurricanes force, Michael ranked as the third-strongest storm on record to make landfall in the continental United States.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Only Hurricane Camille on the Mississippi Gulf Coast in 1969 and the so-called Labor Day hurricane of 1935 in the Florida Keys were more intense.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: President Donald Trump declared a state of emergency for all of Florida, freeing up federal assistance to supplement state and local disaster responses.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: About 3,500 Florida National Guard troops were deployed to assist with evacuations and storm recovery, along with more than 1,000 search-and-rescue personnel, Governor Rick Scott said.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: The Pentagon said it had pre-positioned more than 2,200 active-duty military personnel, along with helicopters, high-water vehicles and swift-water boats for deployment as needed.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: Even before landfall, the hurricane disrupted energy operations in the Gulf, cutting crude oil production by more than 40 percent and natural gas output by nearly a third as offshore platforms were evacuated ahead of the storms arrival.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: MAZATLAN, Mexico (Reuters) - Hurricane Willa slammed into Mexicos Pacific coast late on Tuesday, raking it with winds of 120 mph (195 kph) that brought power outages, buffeted buildings, and dumped torrential rain on tourist resorts where thousands of people had moved to safety.
Label: Main

Sentence: Whipping palm trees, bending power lines and causing floods, the center of Willa struck the coast near the town of Isla del Bosque in the northwestern state of Sinaloa, where many coastal areas had been evacuated before the storm hit.
Label: Main

Sentence: Willa, a Category 3 storm on the five-step Saffir-Simpson scale was one of the most powerful hurricanes to hit Mexico from the Pacific in recent years.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: It was due to dissipate fast as it moved inland, the National Hurricane Center (NHC) said.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: It was really strong, said Cecilia Crespo, a spokeswoman for police in Escuinapa, a seaside town near to where the storm plowed inland.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: It knocked down trees, lamps, poles, walls, she added by telephone.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Theres no electricity.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The storm drove into Mexico about 50 miles (80 km) south of Mazatlan, a major city and tourist resort in Sinaloa.
Label: Main

Sentence: Willa had reached rare Category 5 status on Monday with winds near 160 mph (260 kph) before it began to lose power.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Willa weakened as it moved inland but was still blowing winds of 115 mph (185 kph) more than an hour after it struck the coast and began advancing toward the state of Durango.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Speaking by telephone, Jose Garcia, another resident of the hardest-hit area, said he had hunkered down with others in an Escuinapa hotel waiting for the storm to pass, listening to it rattle buildings as it drove onwards.
Label: Distant_Anecdotal

Sentence: People were very alarmed, the 60-year-old said.
Label: Distant_Anecdotal

Sentence: The storm did not strike hard in Mazatlans historic city center, which was nearly deserted ahead of its arrival.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: My house is made of sheet metal, wood and cardboard, and Im scared it will fall on top of me, said Rosa Maria Carrillo, 36, at a city shelter with her five children, aged 8 to 15.
Label: Distant_Anecdotal

Sentence: Several other tourist getaways in the state of Nayarit, as well as the beach resort of Puerto Vallarta in Jalisco state, were close to Willas path, which was forecast to bring a life-threatening storm surge of ocean water, wind and rainfall.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Up to 18 inches (45 cm) of rainfall could pummel parts of the storm zone, the Miami-based hurricane center said.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The flood risk was compounded by rains caused by Vicente, a storm that dissipated early on Tuesday, having drenched parts of Jalisco, Colima, Michoacan and Guerrero states.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Nayarits government said it would continue to suspend classes across 10 municipalities on Wednesday.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Even buildings up to 500 meters (1,640 feet) distant from the coastline could lose power and suffer physical damage, Mexicos National Meteorological Service said.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: MEXICO BEACH, Fla. (Reuters) - Searchers on Friday uncovered the first body in the rubble of the Florida town of Mexico Beach, which was nearly obliterated by Hurricane Michael, as the toll from the historic storm rose to at least 18 and was expected to climb further.
Label: Main

Sentence: Rescue teams, hampered by power and telephone outages, used cadaver dogs, drones and heavy equipment to hunt for hundreds of people unaccounted for in devastated communities across the Florida Panhandle.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Ive watched on television, thinking of what others have experienced, like in the Carolinas and Texas, Mexico Beach Mayor Al Cathey told reporters referring to earlier hurricanes.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: But its different when you walk down and see this, and your emotions run away.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: This is just a small unique coastal community.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: No other information was available about the dead man found in Mexico Beach, said Joseph Zahralban, Miamis fire chief who was leading a search and rescue unit.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: He said it was unclear if the man lived alone or with a family.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Three deaths were reported in Marianna, in Jackson County, Florida, Sheriff Lou Roberts told a news conference on Friday afternoon.
Label: Main

Sentence: Florida accounts for nine of the storm-related deaths, with five more in Virginia, three in North Carolina and one in Georgia.
Label: Main

Sentence: The death toll is expected to rise as rescuers go house-to-house and comb through the rubble in Mexico Beach and other Florida coastal communities, such as Port St. Joe and Panama City, said Brock Long, administrator of the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA).
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The Houston-based volunteer search-and-rescue network CrowdSource Rescue said its teams were trying to find about 2,100 people either reported missing or stranded and in need of help in Florida, co-founder Matthew Marchetti said.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Social media websites were crowded with messages from those trying to reach missing family in Floridas Bay and Gulf Counties.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Marchetti said his volunteer search teams, consisting mostly of off-duty police officers and firefighters, also had rescued or accounted for 345 others previously reported to CrowdSource Rescue since Michael struck on Wednesday.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: DOGS AND BULLDOZERS
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: FEMA crews have been using bulldozers and other heavy equipment to push a path through debris so rescuers can sift the rubble using specially trained search dogs.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: More than 1,700 search and rescue workers have been deployed, Governor Rick Scotts office said in a statement, including seven swift-water rescue teams and nearly 300 ambulances.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Michael crashed ashore near Mexico Beach on Wednesday afternoon as one of the most powerful storms in U.S. history, with winds of up to 155 mph (250 kph).
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: It pushed a wall of seawater inland, causing widespread flooding.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: The tropical storm, which grew in less than two days into a Category 4 hurricane on the five-step Saffir-Simpson scale, tore apart entire neighborhoods in the Panhandle, reducing homes to naked concrete foundations or piles of wood and siding.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Except for the emergency 911 system, authorities in Bay County, the epicenter of the disaster, were virtually without telephone or internet service until late on Friday, making communications internally and with the public difficult.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: We didnt have anything, said Ruth Corley, a spokeswoman for the Bay County Sheriffs Department.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Weve been writing things down on pieces of paper.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Were doing what we can with the minimal media that we have.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: She said local television stations were knocked off the air for two days, and authorities were relying on the Gulf State College radio station to transmit public service bulletins.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Search teams went door-to-door hunting victims.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: REBUILD RIGHT
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: FEMAs Long urged communities such as Mexico Beach, where many homes were pulverized by 12 to 14 feet (3.7 to 4.3 meters) of storm surge, to rebuild to withstand future storms.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Its OK if you want to live on the coast or on top of a mountain that sees wildfires or whatever, but you have to build to a higher standard, he said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: If were going to rebuild, do it right.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: By Friday morning the storm remnants were about 275 miles (445 km) southwest of Nantucket, Massachusetts, packing maximum sustained winds of 65 mph (100 kph).
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: More than 940,000 homes and businesses on the U.S. East Coast were without power and it could be weeks before power is restored to the most damaged parts of Florida.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The numbers in emergency shelters were expected to swell to 20,000 across five states by Friday, said Brad Kieserman of the American Red Cross.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The Coast Guard said it rescued 129 people.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Even as rescuers searched the rubble for survivors or the dead, some Mexico Beach residents were nervously trickling back, expressing hope the place, nicknamed the Forgotten Coast, would not change too much as it rebuilds.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: It was the perfect beach town.
Label: Distant_Anecdotal

Sentence: Not all of that commercialism, said Dottie Sinclair, 57, a nurse, adding a Subway fast-food restaurant was the only commercial chain.
Label: Distant_Anecdotal

Sentence: I dont think it will ever be the same, said her husband Danny, 64, who is semi-retired.

Sentence: People will just pack up and leave.
Label: Distant_Anecdotal

Sentence: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6 (Xinhua) -- Florence has weakened slightly to a Category 3 hurricane but should remain a powerful storm for several more days, the U.S. National Hurricane Center (NHC) said late Wednesday.
Label: Main

Sentence: The hurricane was located about 1,990 km east-southeast of Bermuda and 1,750 km east-northeast of the northern Leeward Islands, with maximum sustained winds of 205 km per hour, according to the Miami-based weather agency.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Some gradual weakening is forecast during the next 48 hours, with restrengthening possible over the weekend, it added.
Label: Main

Sentence: There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Florence, the first major hurricane of the Atlantic season, was upgraded to a Category 4 hurricane earlier in the day, with maximum sustained winds of 215 km per hour.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Florence is the basin's sixth named storm of the year.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Forecasters have said the Atlantic hurricane season is now expected to be less active as it enters its peak months due to a combination of conditions in the ocean and atmosphere that helps to limit storm development.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: They are expecting nine to 13 named storms with winds of 62 km per hour or higher, of which four to seven will strengthen into hurricanes.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Of those storms, there may be up to two major hurricanes, which are classified as Category 3, 4 and 5 with winds of 177 km per hour or higher.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Tropical Storm Gordon has weakened into a tropical depression over the U.S. state of Mississippi after making landfall late Tuesday near the Alabama-Mississippi border with near-hurricane level winds, killing a two-year-old child when a tree fell on her family's mobile home in Pensacola, Florida.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: By Wednesday afternoon, Gordon's center was well inland, dumping heavy rains and causing flooding in western Florida and coastal Alabama, the NHC said.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: BERLIN, Jan. 18 (Xinhua) -- Storm Friederike brought powerful winds, heavy rain, and snowfall to parts of Germany on Thursday, causing at least one fatality and severe disruption to railway lines.
Label: Main

Sentence: A 59-year-old man was killed by a falling tree and several people were injured in similar incidents throughout the country following the arrival of storm in the morning.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: Trains ceased operation in the states of North-Rhine Westphalia and Lower Saxony, leaving many passengers stranded.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: Furthermore, travel speeds of trains in other parts of Germany were slowed considerably in reaction to hurricane-strength gusts.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: So far, extreme wind strengths of up to 130 km per hour have been measured at higher elevations of Western Germany.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Large amounts of snow fell closer to the Alps in the state of Baden-Wuerttemberg.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The national meteorological service (DWD) has advised citizens to remain indoors in areas most-affected by the storm due to risks posed by falling debris, de-rooted trees, and potential damage to power lines.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Schools in several German states were closed for the day.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: Major airports have been adversely affected by the weather as well.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Flights were cancelled out of security concerns at Duesseldorf airport, while the Cologne-Bonn airport was forced to temporarily close down entirely.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: The DWD believes Friederike will leave behind less damage than experienced after storm Xavier in October 2017.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: At the time, trees carried more leaves and were particularly prone to collapse under wind pressure due to their larger surface area.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Seven people were killed in related incidents.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: HAVANA, May 29 (Xinhua) -- Four people have died in Cuba over the last two days due to heavy rains associated with subtropical storm Alberto, which led to massive floods in the island nation's central provinces as well as damage to roads, bridges, houses and state institutions.

Sentence: HAVANA, Sept. 25 (Xinhua) -- Cuba on Monday offered humanitarian and medical aid to Puerto Rico which was hit by the devastating Hurricane Maria last week and left in a precarious economic and social situation.

Sentence: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 19 (Xinhua) -- The death toll from the massive wildfire in Northern California, dubbed the Camp Fire, has climbed to 79, while the number of unaccounted for decreased by nearly 300, said authorities on Monday evening.

Sentence: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 23 (Xinhua) -- The deadliest wildfire in 100 years in the United States, Northern California's Camp Fire, is nearly fully contained after burning for more than two weeks, according to the California Department of Forestry and Fire Protection (Cal Fire).

Sentence: The massive fire, which has taken the lives of 84 people and scorched 153,336 acres (620 square kms), is 95 percent contained as of Friday morning, said Cal Fire in its latest incident update.

Sentence: THIRUVANANTHAPURAM, India, Aug. 25 (Xinhua) -- A blame game has begun between India's two southern states - Kerala and Tamil Nadu over the cause of the devastating floods which claimed nearly 370 lives and left over 1.3 million people homeless in Kerala.

Sentence: The government of Kerala told the country's apex court - Supreme Court of India, on Friday that the floods occurred because its neighboring state Tamil Nadu released water from its Mullaperiyar dam.

Sentence: The sudden release of water caused an "overload" in the Idukki reservoir, in Kerala, downstream and water had to be released, Kerala said in an affidavit in the Supreme Court, filed in response to a petition that wanted a reduction of water level at the Mullaperiyar dam.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: In its petition, Kerala stated that it had repeatedly suggested to Tamil Nadu to "gradually" release water from Mullaperiyar dam, but the latter did not pay heed to it.

Sentence: Tamil Nadu contended that it released water on Aug. 16, nearly a week after floods situation erupted in Kerala, which was battered by torrential rains since Aug. 8 that partly led to the worst ever monsoons in a century.

Sentence: In its counter-affidavit submitted before the apex court, Tamil Nadu government stated that the volume of water released from its Mullaperiyar dam to Idukki dam in Kerala was far less than the quantity exceeded by Idukki and Idamalaiyar dams (in Kerala).

Sentence: The next date of hearing is scheduled for Sept. 6.

Sentence: Meanwhile, those affected by the deluge said water suddenly gushed into their homes in the wee hours of Aug. 15 when they were still asleep, and that there was "no prior warning" from the state administration.

Sentence: NANCHANG, July 18 (Xinhua) -- Holding a smartphone in his hand, He Xuehao, director of the flood control office in Anqing City, China's Anhui Province, knows everything about the city's real-time precipitation and hydrologic conditions.

Sentence: Determining rising water levels is one of the biggest challenges for the flood control office.

Sentence: He still remembers that 20 years ago, when he was 16 years old, he had to patrol dikes every two hours, with a bamboo pole, a flashlight, and an umbrella, for days on end.

Sentence: In addition, a series of flood control equipment has been put into use.

Sentence: In just 10 minutes, the "wall" can swell up to six meters, serving as a water barrier.

Sentence: "China has comprehensively strengthened its flood resistance ability in the past 20 years," He said.

Sentence: BEIJING, July 12 (Xinhua) -- China's disaster relief authorities launched a level IV emergency response plan Thursday to help flood victims in west China's Sichuan and Gansu provinces.
Label: Main

Sentence: About 932,000 people in Sichuan Province were affected by floods caused by heavy rains by midday Thursday, with three deaths and 101,000 people evacuated.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Over 600 houses fell and 36,900 hectares of farmland were flooded.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The province suffered direct economic losses worth 2.4 billion yuan (360.1 million U.S. dollars).
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Gansu Province saw about 1.082 million people affected, 12 deaths, four people missing and 27,000 people evacuated.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Over 1,200 houses fell and total direct economic losses reached 1.47 billion yuan.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The central government has sent relief work teams to flood-hit regions to guide relief efforts.
Label: Main

Sentence: Sichuan relief authority has sent 2,000 quilts and 1,000 cotton-padded coats and other supplies to flood-hit regions while Gansu has allocated 8.39 million yuan for disaster relief.
Label: Main

Sentence: WASHINGTON  A Mexican drug cartel member pleaded guilty in U.S. District Court here Thursday to the murder of U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement special agent Jaime Zapata of Brownsville during an ambush in Mexico.
Label: Main

Sentence: Julian Zapata Espinoza, 32, known as ''El Piolin' or ''Tweety Bird,'' also pleaded guilty to the attempted murder of ICE special agent Victor Avila, according to Justice Department officials.
Label: Main

Sentence: ''Special agent Zapata died for his country in a senseless brutal attack, and special agent Avila was grievously wounded in the same ambush by members of the Los Zetas cartel,'' said Mythili(CQ) Raman(CQ), acting assistant U.S. attorney.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Following the plea, the federal court unsealed documents that revealed the guilty pleas of three other defendants in the Mexico ambush who were also charged with murder, attempted murder and racketeering.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Ruben Dario Venegas Rivera, 25 and Jose Ismael Nava Villagran, 30, pleaded guilty to murder and attempted murder.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Francisco Carbajal Flores, 38, pleaded guilty to racketeering.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Espinoza, Rivera and Villagran admitted to being members of a Los Zetas hit squad who participated in the Feb. 15, 2011 ambush of the special agents.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: The agents were serving as ICE agents in Mexico when they were surrounded and forced off the highway while traveling between Mexico City and Monterrey, near San Luis Potosi.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Espinoza ordered the agents out of the vehicle.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: When the agents refused and tried to identify themselves as American diplomats from the U.S. Embassy, the hit squad members fired into the vehicle.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The Zeta members continued to fire at the vehicle as the agents tried to escape by driving away.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Zapata died from gunshot wounds he suffered in the attack.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The suspects were later captured by Mexican authorities.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Espinoza was extradited to Washington to face murder and attempted murder charges.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Ronald Machen(CQ), the U.S. attorney for the District of Columbia, said the attack on U.S. agents demanded ''an intense, dedicated and forceful response.''
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Machen said the response served as a message to others that if you commit an act against a U.S. law enforcement agent in a foreign land, ''we will not forget, we will not falter and we will not rest until you are brought to justice.''
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The 2011 attack on the two U.S. agents in Mexico also led to the arrest and conviction on weapons violations of a Dallas-area man, Otilio Osorio, who illegally sold a replica AK-47 assault rifle that was found at the murder scene.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The attack also prompted outrage in Congress.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: A bipartisan bill passed last year, and spearheaded by Rep. Michael McCaul, R-Austin; Rep. Henry Cuellar, D-Laredo; and Rep. Blake Farenthold, R-Corpus Christi, authorized $10 million over five years for cross-border training for U.S. and Mexican law enforcement and military.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The bipartisan bill was named for agent Zapata, 32, who served in Laredo before he was transferred to the U.S. Department of Homeland Security investigations unit on human trafficking and smuggling in Mexico.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: WASHINGTON - President Barack Obama defied Republican critics Thursday by nominating to a high-ranking State Department job an official involved in editing controversial talking points about the attack last year in Libya.
Label: Main

Sentence: Obama sent the Senate his choice of Victoria Nuland, a former spokeswoman for the State Department, as assistant secretary for European and Eurasian affairs.
Label: Main

Sentence: Nuland had long been in line for the position, but some had questioned whether the nomination would go forward after drafts of the talking points became public.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Nuland suggested revisions to talking points prepared by the CIA after the terrorist attack that killed four Americans at the diplomatic post in Benghazi, Libya, on Sept. 11.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: In an email, she urged deleting mention of past warnings of terrorism in Libya because lawmakers could use that to beat the State Department for not paying attention.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Her confirmation hearings may serve to revive the furor.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: But Nuland, a career Foreign Service officer, has strong ties on both sides of the aisle, having served as deputy national security adviser to Vice President Dick Cheney and ambassador to NATO under President George W. Bush.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Obama on Thursday also nominated Douglas E. Lute, his adviser on Afghanistan and Pakistan, to be the next ambassador to NATO, replacing Ivo Daalder, who is leaving the post this summer to become president of the Chicago Council on Global Affairs.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: A career Army officer, Lute first went to work for Bush as his Iraq and Afghanistan war coordinator and stayed on under Obama, focused specifically on Afghanistan.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: He retired as a lieutenant general in 2010, remaining in the White House as a civilian and helping shape the presidents plan to withdraw combat forces by the end of 2014.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: MEXICO CITY - Guatemalan officials rousted an imprisoned former president Friday and put him on a plane to the U.S. to face long-pending corruption charges.
Label: Main

Sentence: The extradition of the former president, Alfonso Portillo, who had fought being sent to the U.S. for two years, caught much of Guatemala by surprise and came amid complaints about the countrys willingness to attack impunity among elites.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The extradition followed a high court decision this week to annul a genocide verdict against a former dictator, Gen. Efran Ros Montt, who had been convicted of trying to annihilate an indigenous group during Guatemalas nearly four-decade civil war, which ended in 1996.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: On Monday the court found procedural problems in the trial and ruled that part of it must be repeated.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Portillo, who was president from 2000 to 2004, faces charges in U.S. court in New York of conspiring to launder about $70 million of his countrys funds through U.S. banks.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: As police officers put him on a plane, swarmed by reporters, Portillo said he was being kidnapped and predicted that he would be back when the case fell apart.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: After leaving office, he worked in Mexico as a financial adviser until he was extradited to Guatemala in 2008 to face embezzlement charges.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: In 2010, the U.S. filed its own charges against him for what a prosecutor called converting the office of the Guatemalan presidency into his personal ATM.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The following year, he was acquitted in the Guatemala case, but the U.S. continued to push for his prosecution.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: He has been held in prison and in a military hospital, where he was treated for liver and heart ailments.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: He was flown to the U.S. in an air ambulance.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: On Friday morning the interior minister authorized his transfer, a decision that the U.S. Embassy called an important affirmation of the rule of law and due process.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The timing stirred skepticism among analysts, coming as international criticism of the justice system had grown after the erratic course of the Ros Montt case.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Protesters took to the streets of Guatemala City on Friday to denounce the courts decision to nullify the verdict.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Anita J. Isaacs, a professor at Haverford College who studies Guatemala, said the decision to extradite Portillo had to be seen as an attempt to divert attention from the overturning of the Ros Montt verdict.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: LONDON - Britains security agencies appeared headed for a period of deeply uncomfortable scrutiny after the government said Sunday that it had been aware for more than two years that one of the two men suspected of hacking an off-duty British soldier to death on a London street had ties to al-Qaida.
Label: Main

Sentence: A Foreign Office spokesman confirmed that the ministry had provided consular assistance in Kenya in 2010 to the man, Michael Adebolajo, 28, a British citizen of Nigerian descent.
Label: Main

Sentence: He had been arrested by the Kenyan police on suspicion of planning to join al-Shabab, an extremist group in Somalia that Britain has classified as a terrorist organization.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Adebolajo and the other suspect in the London attack - Michael Adebowale, 22, also of Nigerian origin - have been under armed police guard in separate London hospitals since the attack Wednesday.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The soldier - Lee Rigby, 25 - was run down by a car on the sidewalk outside an army barracks, then attacked with meat cleavers.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Police officers arriving on the scene shot and wounded the two suspects.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The grisly brutality of the attack shocked Britain as few events have since the bombings on the London transit system on July 7, 2005, which killed 52 passengers and the four bombers.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Sunday newspaper headlines about the case focused on what the government knew about Adebolajo and Adebowale and why no action was taken that might have prevented Rigbys death.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: In a statement on Sunday, the Foreign Office spokesman sought to tamp down the controversy, saying that the offices role in the events in Kenya in November 2010 was limited to consular assistance to Adebolajo, as normal for British nationals. It did not address the Kenyan governments statements that Adebolajo, using a false name, had been arrested near the Somali border with five Kenyan nationals while carrying al-Shabab literature.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The statement also did not address a claim made on BBC television on Friday night that Adebolajo spoke of rebuffing an attempt by MI5, the British domestic security agency, to recruit him.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The claim was made by Ibrahim Hassan, a man who says he has links to Islamic extremist groups.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Hassan said Adebolajo had told him that the recruitment attempt was made after he was deported from Kenya.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: British security officials quoted in the Sunday newspapers said that efforts to recruit Islamic extremists in such circumstances were common.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Hassan himself was arrested in the BBC studio immediately after the interview by Scotland Yard counterterrorism detectives, who said that the arrest was not connected to the killing of Rigby.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Hassans claims and his arrest added to a growing sense that inquiries into Rigbys death are likely to delve into the murky world of the security agencies and their dealings with Islamic extremists.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: A Parliamentary panel, the Intelligence and Security Committee, has said it expects to receive a preliminary report from the government on the attack this week.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Among the issues that the panels leading members have said they want to explore is whether MI5s desire to penetrate groups with suspected terrorist ties had led to decisions not to prosecute people like Adebolajo under laws that bar Britons from engaging with terrorist organizations overseas.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Security officials have said that MI5 viewed Adebolajo as posing a low risk of potential terrorism and did think he needed close monitoring.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Security officials have also confirmed that Adebolajo, and to a more limited extent Adebowale, had been known to British security officials for several years because they took part in protests in Britain that were organized by extremist groups, some of which involved violent clashes with the police.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Newspapers in Britain have carried accounts saying that Adebolajo had been heard in mosques and community centers in south London calling for jihadist attacks in Britain.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Muslim community groups have condemned the killing of Rigby in unequivocal terms, and say that many British Muslims are deeply apprehensive over a number of incidents of hostile graffiti and invective since his death, despite appeals for calm from Prime Minister David Cameron, the archbishop of Canterbury, the Most Rev.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Justin Welby, and other prominent figures.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Tensions may rise further this week, when post-mortem details on Rigby are expected to be made public.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The report may shed light on several aspects of the brutal attack that have seized public attention, including whether he was still alive after the car hit him, and whether he was beheaded, as some witnesses say.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The police have so far declined to address those questions.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Bausch & Lomb, the eye care company, agreed Monday to sell itself to Valeant Pharmaceuticals International of Canada for about $8.7 billion, sidestepping the lengthier process of an initial public offering.
Label: Main

Sentence: Under the terms of the deal, Valeant will pay $4.5 billion to the investor group that owns Bausch & Lomb, led by the private equity firm Warburg Pincus.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: It will also spend about $4.2 billion to repay Bausch & Lombs debt.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The deal continues the flurry of deal-making in the health care industry, as companies seek to buy the growth they are hard-pressed to generate on their own.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Announced merger volume in the sector this year is up 14 percent from the period a year earlier, even as takeovers have fallen 8 percent.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Valeant, which is based in Laval, Quebec, has made acquisitions a core part of its growth strategy.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The Bausch & Lomb deal is the companys biggest yet, over three times larger than the $2.6 billion purchase of the skin care company Medicis Pharmaceutical last year.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Adding Bausch & Lomb, a giant maker of contact lens solution and surgical devices, will significantly bolster Valeants offerings in the sector.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Bausch & Lomb will absorb its new parents existing ophthalmology operations, creating a business that is expected to generate over $3.5 billion in net revenue this year.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: We believe its a great move for the company, J. Michael Pearson, Valeants chief executive, said in an interview by phone.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Theres an opportunity for a lot of singles and doubles here.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The takeover also means a tidy payday for Warburg Pincus, which led a $4.5 billion leveraged buyout of Bausch & Lomb in 2007.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The firm already benefited from a $772 million special dividend Bausch & Lomb paid out in March, the bulk of which went to its controlling investor group.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Through the deal, Warburg Pincus is expected to reap a return of as much as three times its original investment, according to a person briefed on the matter.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Warburg Pincus had begun exploring a sale or initial public offering for Bausch & Lomb late last year, and held preliminary talks with a number of potential bidders.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Among them was Valeant, though Pearson said that at the time he and his board could not justify paying the more than $10 billion Warburg Pincus was seeking.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Instead, Bausch & Lomb filed for an initial public offering in March.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Until last month, Valeant was pursuing a takeover of a different company, the generic drugmaker Actavis, in what would have been a deal worth over $13 billion.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: When those talks collapsed, Valeant then pivoted to Bausch & Lomb.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Pearson said the bulk of the work on Mondays transaction took place over last week, with much of the initial due diligence having been completed already.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Though Valeants offer was lower than the valuation Bausch & Lomb would have fetched in an initial offering, it allowed Warburg Pincus to exit its investment quickly.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Taking the eye care company public would have meant a more gradual sale over two to three years.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: The transaction is expected to close in the third quarter, pending regulatory approval.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Pearson said that while integrating Bausch & Lomb would take some time, Valeant will continue to pursue what he described as smaller tuck in acquisitions.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: But deal-making will remain a core part of the companys growth plans.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Our strategy is our strategy, he said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Our aspiration is to become the most valuable pharmaceutical company in the world.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: WASHINGTON - President Barack Obama plans to nominate James B. Comey, a former hedge fund executive and a former senior Justice Department official under President George W. Bush, to replace Robert S. Mueller III as the director of the FBI, according to a person with knowledge of the selection.
Label: Main

Sentence: Comey, 52, was chosen for the position over the other finalist for the job, Lisa O. Monaco, who has served as the White Houses top counterterrorism adviser since January.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Some Democrats had feared that if the president nominated Monaco - who oversaw national security issues at the Justice Department during the attacks in Benghazi, Libya, in September - Republicans would use the confirmation process as a forum for criticism of the administrations handling of the attack.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: As deputy attorney general in the Bush administration, Comey was a critical player in 2004 in the dramatic hospital room episode in which the White House counsel, Alberto Gonzales, and Bushs chief of staff, Andrew H. Card Jr., tried to persuade Attorney General John Ashcroft - who was ill and disoriented - to reauthorize a warrantless eavesdropping program.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Comey, who was serving as the acting attorney general and had been tipped off that Gonzales and Card were trying to go around him, rushed to Ashcrofts hospital room to thwart them.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: With Comey in the room, Ashcroft refused to reauthorize the program.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: After the episode, Bush agreed to make changes in the program, and Comey was widely praised for putting the law over politics.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Comey graduated from the University of Chicago Law School in 1985, then had a meteoric rise at the Justice Department, culminating in his service as the departments second-ranking official from 2003 to 2005.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: While oversee the U.S. attorneys office in Richmond, Va., Comey was asked in 2001 to take over the governments foundering investigation of the 1996 terrorist bombing at Khobar Towers in Saudi Arabia that killed 19 American service members.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The FBI director at the time, Louis J. Freeh, had urged Ashcroft to take the case away from federal prosecutors in Washington who had been investigating for five years but had not brought charges.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: With a legal deadline looming over them, Comey and a colleague rapidly moved the case forward and within three months indicted 14 men.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Rick Scott is the first governor in the history of Florida (and likely the last) to travel the state in his own personal jet.
Label: Main

Sentence: Hes a one-man airline.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Air Scott.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: As a candidate in 2010, Scott thought it was extravagant for taxpayers to pay for two state aircraft to transport politicians in the nations fourth-largest state.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Elect me, Scott promised, and Ill get rid of those expensive toys.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: He got elected and ditched both planes, which would have been impossible if Scott wasnt rich enough to travel in style on his own nickel.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Selling the planes grounded other state officials, who must travel by car or fly on the rare scheduled commercial flights out of Tallahassee, which is often impractical.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: In todays Florida, the only elected official who gets to fly is the one who can afford it.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Everywhere Scott goes, he does it on his own aircraft at his own expense, and after nearly two-and-a-half years in office, he has decided he needs an upgrade.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Scott is selling his eight-passenger Hawker 400XP, made by Raytheon in 2004, for $1.495 million.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: An ad for the jet on the website controller.com says the jet is in Bonita Springs and notes: ''Price reduction!
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Sale pending.''
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Scotts new chariot is a 2008 Cessna Citation Excel, a 12-passenger twin-engine jet with a dropped aisle that offers enough headroom for Scott to stand tall in the cabin.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The Cessna is white with pink trim and the planes tail number ends with the letters ''AS,'' which can only stand for first lady Ann Scott (the old planes tail number ended with ''RS').
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The new plane, like the old one, is registered to a Naples holding company, Columbia Collier Properties, whose signatory on legal documents is Ann Scott.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The purchase price of the new plane was not immediately available, and its not the kind of information the governors office would willingly provide.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: ''The governor wants to travel the state as often as possible to listen to the concerns and ideas of Floridians,'' said Scotts chief spokeswoman, Melissa Sellers.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Scott travels more often than his predecessor and possible future rival, Charlie Crist, who traveled at taxpayers expense.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: In fact, the Republican Party of Florida, as part of a series critically examining Crists record, noted that Monday was the fourth anniversary of a Times/Herald story that cited his use of state aircraft to attract publicity at ceremonial bill-signing events while campaigning for the U.S. Senate.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: By paying for all of his flight costs, Scott has saved taxpayers a bundle, but exactly how much is a mystery.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The governors office says it has no records reflecting the costs to operate and maintain his own plane.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Also not known is how much of a tax benefit Scott derives by using his jet for business purposes.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Scott doesnt take a government salary, either.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: He is paid a penny a month, or 12 cents a year, which the state says is the minimum necessary for him to be registered in the state personnel system.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Katherine Seeber, a Wilton woman who was paroled 10 months ago after spending a dozen years in prison for the killing of her step-great-grandmother, was fatally stabbed in Queens, New York City police said.
Label: Main

Sentence: Seebers boyfriend, Pedro Sanchez, was charged with second-degree murder Wednesday for the killing, said Detective Martin Tinspeechley.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: Its the same charge Seeber pleaded guilty to in 2000 for her role in the death of 91-year-old Ruth Witter in a robbery gone awry.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Both the attorney who defended Seeber for more than a decade and the prosecutor who sought to put her behind bars said Seebers death appears to be the final chapter in a life that all too often centered around abusive relationships.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The criminal case against Seeber was one of the lengthiest and most unusual legal sagas Saratoga County has ever seen.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Allegations surfaced that a veteran police investigator who committed suicide had mishandled evidence, a retrial was ordered and the case ultimately ended with a rarely used plea deal.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: ''It was probably one of the most complex cases weve seen, procedurally,'' said Saratoga County District Attorney James A. Murphy III, who took over as district attorney the year before Witter was killed.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Murphy said prosecutors in Queens called him about Seebers death late Wednesday night.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: ''Its sad, especially in her context, but I cant say I was surprised,'' Murphy said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: ''She was very troubled her whole life.''
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: New York City police could not say what led to Seebers death.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: She was found dead in her 55th Street home in Astoria Tuesday evening.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Police said Seeber had only known Sanchez a few months.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The New York Daily News reported Sanchez confronted Seeber, 32, about her seeing another man and then stabbed her in the torso and face with a kitchen knife.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Both the Daily News and the New York Post reported Sanchez tried to clean up the scene after killing Seeber.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: In addition to murder, Sanchez was also charged with criminal possession of a weapon, evidence tampering and resisting arrest.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The parole program that oversaw Seebers release helped her find housing in Queens.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: John Cuilla, the recently retired Saratoga County public defender who represented Seeber since 2000, said Seeber planned on moving to Washington to live with her brother.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: ''Its a tragic ending,'' Cuilla said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: ''It appears that she just could not get out of that cycle of domestic violence.''
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Seeber was raised in Rexburg, Idaho, a predominantly Mormon city of 17,000 on the eastern edge of the state.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: There, Cuilla said, Seebers parents troubled marriage first exposed her to domestic violence.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: A once-promising student who aspired to a career in the military, Seeber moved to the Capital Region in 1998.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Both prosecutors and Cuilla say Seeber, whose family said she never smoked or drank as a teenager out west, quickly fell in with the wrong crowd.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: She started dating Jeffrey Hampshire.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The teenage couple spent most of their time partying.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: During one binge in February 2000, Seeber and Hampshire went to Witters Mordella Road home in Colonie looking for items to steal and pawn for cash for a hotel party.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: A struggle ensued.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Witter was strangled with an electrical cord.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The nonagenarians frozen body was found in a snowy ditch in Stillwater, her ankles and feet bound with tape, a gag in her mouth.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Though she was killed in Colonie, the case ended up in Murphys hands because the couple crossed into Saratoga County to dispose of the body.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: After prosecutors said Seeber unknowingly led detectives to Witters body, both Seeber, then 18, and Hampshire, then 19, were charged with murder.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Seeber pleaded guilty.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Hampshire went to trial and was acquitted.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Hampshire, however, was already facing an unrelated burglary charge and would later be arrested for multiple felonies, including helping cover up a fatal hit-and-run crash.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Seeber first unsuccessfully appealed her murder plea in 2004 on the grounds that she was not in the house to commit another crime, a prerequisite for the murder charge.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Then, in 2011, Seeber appealed again when it was found that Gary Veeder, a veteran State Police forensic scientist, had processed some of the evidence in her case.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Veeder committed suicide in 2008 after State Police pressed him about his mishandling of dozens of cases.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Seebers conviction was overturned and a new trial was ordered.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Seeber, however, pleaded guilty to manslaughter and burglary under the rarely used Alford plea, which allows a defendant to maintain his or her innocence but admit that prosecutors likely could have proven criminal charges at trial.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Seeber was sentenced to 141/2 years in prison in May 2012, but was released later that July because of time served.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: At her May 2012 sentencing, Seeber repeatedly apologized to Witters family and invoked religion, saying her life had been turned around and that she wanted to work with domestic violence victims after living through a lifetime of volatile relationships.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: ''I offer this to you not as an excuse,'' Seeber told Witters relatives at her sentencing.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: ''But as an explanation to all your questions for all these years.''
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Both Murphy and Cuilla said that Seeber had changed since Witters killing.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: ''In 2000, she was a naive little 18-year-old girl who lived through domestic violence her whole life,'' Cuilla said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: He said he was dismayed that it appeared she had recently fallen into another abusive relationship with Sanchez.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: ''I thought she was ready to come out and be a productive member of society.''
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Detectives who questioned Seeber in 2000 described her as unremorseful, cold and tough.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Hampshires lawyers portrayed Seeber as the mastermind behind Witters killing.

Sentence: In 2005, Hampshires then attorney, Cheryl Coleman, described Seeber as ''the single most frightening sociopath I have ever met.''

Sentence: PALM SPRINGS, Calif. - President Barack Obama and Chinas new president, Xi Jinping, arrived at a famed desert estate here Friday evening for their unusually informal weekend meeting, starting with discussions of security issues that bedevil them, including North Koreas nuclear threat, on which the United States sees a chance at greater cooperation.

Sentence: On a day when the temperature here reached 110 degrees, Obama and Xi, along with their interpreters and closest aides, retreated to the comfort of the sprawling Sunnylands estate in nearby Rancho Mirage, built by the publishing magnate Walter H. Annenberg.

Sentence: On the question of tensions with North Korea, inflamed this year by a series of belligerent statements and actions from its young leader, Kim Jong Un, the administration has welcomed what officials have described as a growing impatience in China - on the part of Xi in particular - with its longstanding ally in Pyongyang.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: That has raised administration hopes of new cooperation.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: China voted with the rest of the U.N. Security Council to impose new sanctions on North Korea after it tested a nuclear device in February.

Sentence: And when a close adviser to Kim visited China last month, Xi bluntly told him that North Korea should resume international negotiations intended to force it to abandon its nuclear arsenal.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Xi also appears to have invested heavily in the meetings here with Obama.

Sentence: Xi, who took office in March, told Obamas departing national security adviser, Tom Donilon, who arranged the meetings, that the relationship between the United States and China had reached a critical juncture and that he wanted to develop a new type of great power relationship.

Sentence: China also offered its own gestures in advance of the Sunnylands summit meeting on one of the prickliest issues with the United States: its treatment of human rights.

Sentence: On Friday, only hours before the two leaders met, China granted passports to the mother and brother of Chen Guangcheng, the blind lawyer and activist whose flight from China last year turned into a diplomatic drama between the two countries.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: During the three and a half years that she was held in prison or under house arrest, Judge Lourdes Afiuni became a symbol of political persecution for many in Venezuela under President Hugo Chvez.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: On Friday, a court in Caracas, acting at the governments request, ordered Afiuni to be set free in the latest sign of a shifting political landscape in post-Chvez Venezuela.

Sentence: Afiuni was jailed in December 2009 after issuing a court ruling that infuriated Chvez, who went on television and demanded that she be sentenced to 30 years in prison.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: For years Chvez ignored international appeals for her release, including from the American leftist intellectual Noam Chomsky.

Sentence: Chvez, a charismatic socialist, died in March, leaving a bitterly divided country.

Sentence: His handpicked successor, Nicols Maduro, was elected by a slim margin in April and since then has confronted political turmoil and serious economic difficulties that have tested his nascent leadership skills.

Sentence: He assailed capitalists for causing soaring inflation and rampant product shortages and then sat down with the head of the countrys biggest private company to discuss the economy.

Sentence: Afiunis trial began in November and is continuing, although she has not attended it.

Sentence: The Tampa couple accused of kidnapping their sons at gunpoint and absconding on a sailboat across the Gulf of Mexico tried to formally seek asylum from Cuban authorities, asserting the lives of their children were at risk from U.S. government officials, one parents lawyer said Monday.
Label: Main

Sentence: Joshua and Sharyn Hakken met with a lawyer in Cuba after arriving there in April, and were initially told they would be safe from U.S. law enforcement while their asylum application was reviewed, said Tampa lawyer Bryant Camareno, who is representing Sharyn Hakken.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: ''They sought counsel, and they actually met with a lawyer in Cuba,'' Camareno said.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: ''They felt that their kids lives were in danger from the (U.S.) government.''

Sentence: He said the couple also believed that if Cuba rejected them, they would have time to seek protection at other foreign governments embassies in Havana.

Sentence: The couples dreams of a safe haven abroad were short-lived.

Sentence: Within days of the Hakkens arrival at Hemingway Marina outside Havana, Cuban authorities gave the U.S. permission to apprehend the family and extradite them to Florida.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Both parents are jailed as they await trial in Hillsborough Circuit Court on charges including kidnapping and child abuse.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: But the description of the Hakkens overtures to Cuban officials and fears of government intrusion in their boys lives provides an early glimpse of their mind-set and legal strategy.

Sentence: Camarenos remarks to the Tampa Bay Times, made after Joshua and Sharyn Hakken briefly appeared in court Monday, marked the first time the couples own account of their motives has emerged.

Sentence: The argument that the Hakkens were attempting to extricate their sons from a tyrannical child welfare system also promises to bring more national attention to the bizarre saga of an American family driven by mistrust of government to seek refuge in the Western Hemispheres last communist country.

Sentence: On April 3, according to the Hillsborough County Sheriffs Office, Joshua Hakken, 35, kidnapped his children at gunpoint from the home of his mother-in-law, whom he bound with zip-ties.

Sentence: He and Sharyn Hakken, 34, had lost custody of 4-year-old Cole and 2-year-old Chase after a series of incidents in Louisiana.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: A court later terminated their parental rights.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Authorities said Joshua Hakken was arrested on drug charges in a hotel there last year, and was found with a gun talking about taking a ''journey to Armageddon' in the presence of the boys when he was taken into custody.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The children were placed in foster care following the drug arrest, but Hakken showed up with a gun at their foster home demanding they be returned, according to authorities.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The foster parents called 911 and Hakken fled.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: After the Hakkens extradition from Cuba, their sons were placed back in the custody of their grandmother, who lives north of Tampa.

Sentence: Camareno said he and Jorge Chalela, Joshua Hakkens attorney, are awaiting discovery materials from the Hillsborough State Attorneys Office and are still in the early stages of reviewing the case.

Sentence: But Camareno already expects to call witnesses from Cuba, and he said the case could involve international law and jurisdictional issues.

Sentence: It is unclear what specific justification the Hakkens might have had for claiming special refugee status.
