Sentence: Cuba never signed the United Nations 1951 Refugee Convention, the backbone of international protection for asylum-seekers.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The treaty obligates governments to harbor those who fear persecution in their home countries for their political views, race or religion, among other factors.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: ''They werent too sure of what type of asylum they were seeking,'' Camareno said, ''but they were seeking asylum.''
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: A company alleged to have used deceptive practices to sell supplemental health insurance to veterans and other Massachusetts residents will pay more than $5 million to settle, Attorney General Martha Coakley said Tuesday.
Label: Main

Sentence: The settlement, now totaling $5.25 million, represents an increase of $1.5 million over an earlier agreement reached between Coakleys office and Life Insurance Company of North America, in July 2012.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The increase in restitution to consumers and penalties is a result of the insurers failure to meet the conditions of the original settlement, Coakley said.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: ''LINAs failures to comply fully with its obligations under the consent judgment are unacceptable,'' Coakley said in a statement.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: ''This amendment will ensure that all Massachusetts consumers entitled to relief under the settlement will receive restitution from this company and will help further our ongoing efforts to ensure access to mental health services to veterans and their families.''
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: In a statement, the insurance company said it believes it complied with the provisions of the initial settlement and will continue to return premiums, as it has been doing, to affected Massachusetts residents.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The amended accord, the company said, clarifies both parties understanding of the agreement.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: ''While the company agreed to pay a fine to avoid costly and time-consuming litigation,'' the statement added, ''the settlement recognizes LINAs good-faith belief that it did not represent or market these products as 'health care insurance.'
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Coakleys initial complaint charged that the company used deceptive methods to market health insurance to veterans, especially those from World War II.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: It used direct mail and Internet solicitations to make the insurance appear to be a government program, exaggerating benefits, misrepresenting coverage limits, and making false claims about its rates, according to the attorney generals office.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: It also denied coverage based on preexisting conditions, which is illegal in Massachusetts, according to the complaint.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: More than 1,000 Massachusetts consumers bought the policies, according to Coakleys office.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: The initial settlement required the company to identify all consumers who had purchased supplemental insurance and refund premiums, minus any insurance claims paid by the insurer.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: But many customers have not received their payments, Coakley said.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Coakleys office went back to court to ensure the company would meet its obligations.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: In an amended settlement, the company agreed to pay an additional $750,000 in restitution to consumers, bringing the total to $3.5 million.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: It also agreed to pay an additional $375,000 in penalties and $375,000 to fund mental health services for veterans, on top of the $1 million in the original settlement.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: That brings the total the insurer has agreed to pay the state as a deterrent to $1.75 million, Coakleys office said.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: Last month, with funds from the original settlement, the attorney generals office awarded $500,000 in grants to five organizations to provide mental health services to veterans.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: Gyula Horn, a former leader of Hungary who in 1989 ripped a hole in the Iron Curtain, helping to set off months of tumultuous change in which communist governments in Eastern Europe fell one after the other, died Wednesday in Budapest.
Label: Main

Sentence: He was 80.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The Hungarian government announced the death.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: He had been hospitalized since 2007 with what was reported to be a brain malfunction.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Horns life encompassed much of the history of 20th-century Hungary.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: His father, a communist, was executed by the Nazis occupying Hungary in 1944.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Gyula (pronounced JOO-la) also became a hard-line communist, serving in militia units that hunted down government opponents during their revolt in 1956.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The rebels lynched his brother, also a communist.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: As foreign minister, as Moscows grip on Eastern Europe slipped, Horn proved nimble as a newly minted, nonideological, pragmatic reformer in helping to lead Hungary away from communism.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Elected prime minister as a socialist in 1994, he angered Hungarians by cutting social programs to stanch raging inflation.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Horns indelible image was a photograph taken of him and Alois Mock, the Austrian foreign minister, on June 27, 1989, cutting through once-electrified barbed wire on the border between their two countries.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The men seemed to be tearing the Iron Curtain, the daunting symbol of the ideological rivalry and actual physical boundary between communist and non-communist Europe.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The truth was that the removal of the fence had begun two months earlier, because it was badly in need of repair.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: But the critical meaning of the stunt - which dozens of photographers were invited to document - was that it provoked no reaction in the Soviet Union, although it had tens of thousands of troops stationed in Hungary.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Horn said his purpose was to create an irreversible situation.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Events accelerated.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: East Germans, who had long gone to Hungary to meet with West German friends and relatives, refused to return home.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The border police turned a blind eye when several hundred slipped across to Austria during a picnic Aug. 19.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Three weeks after the picnic, Horn appeared on Hungarian television and announced that the East Germans were free to cross the border.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Two months later, the Berlin Wall was breached and communist dictatorships began to fall.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: In 1990, Horn was awarded the Charlemagne Prize - whose winners include Winston Churchill and Vaclav Havel, the former Czech president - for laying one of the foundation stones for European unity. The prize is given by the city of Aachen, Germany.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Gyula Horn was born July 5, 1932, in Budapest, the capital.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The third of eight children, he was raised in a working-class district of the city.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: After the Gestapo killed his father, he went to work at 11 in manual labor jobs.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: In 1950 he was sent to Russia to study accounting at an economics institute in Rostov on Don.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: He returned to work in Hungarys Finance Ministry.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: He joined the Foreign Ministry in 1959 and served as a diplomat in Bulgaria and Romania before working his way up to deputy foreign minister in 1985 and foreign minister in 1989.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: After Hungarians rebelled against the communist government in 1956, he joined a brigade that helped hunt down and arrest democratic activists.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: He never denied taking these actions, but said he had never hurt anybody.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Nonetheless, two Hungarian presidents vetoed his nomination for high national awards in 2002 and 2007 because of his actions during and after the uprising.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: In the 1970s, Horn worked cautiously to liberalize government controls in Hungary in an experiment that came to be known as goulash communism. As even that system collapsed, he was instrumental in transforming the Communist Party into the Hungarian Socialist Party.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: He became the partys chairman in 1990.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: He was elected to Parliament the same year and retained his seat until 2010.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: In the 1994 election, he led the Socialists to a majority.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: But in forming a government he included liberals as a way to reassure Hungarians and foreigners who were concerned that the former Communist Party might regain power.

Sentence: He stepped down after his party lost in 1998.

Sentence: Horn is survived by his wife, Anna Kiraly; a daughter, Anna; and a son, Gyula Jr.

Sentence: ROME - When Ccile Kyenge accepted the post of minister of integration in Prime Minister Enrico Lettas center-left government, she knew that as Italys first black national official she would be breaking new ground.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: What she may not have expected was the stream of racial slurs that have accompanied her first eight weeks in office.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Death threats have been posted on Facebook, and in one case this month, a City Council member in Padua called for Kyenge to be raped so that she could understand what victims felt.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The councilor, Dolores Valandro, who made the comment in a discussion about a woman said to have been raped by an African man, was subsequently expelled from her party, the anti-immigrant Northern League.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The verbal attacks have been worrying enough that Kyenge, 48, who was born in the Democratic Republic of Congo and moved to Italy at 19, now travels with heightened security.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: She has so far chosen not to respond directly to her detractors but instead has praised the many who have spoken out in her support to underscore the need for Italians to strive for civility.

Sentence: Its up to the institutions, to the population, to give a response to these attacks, Kyenge said in a recent interview in her stately office in central Rome.

Sentence: If discussion alone were the goal, then Kyenges appointment would have already succeeded.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: It has opened a national debate on the tension between the increasingly multicultural nature of Italian society and the undercurrent of racism that is increasingly difficult for Italians to ignore.
Label: Main

Sentence: Experts who track immigration issues say that more subtle and insidious forms of racism are pervasive in Italy as it struggles to come to terms with its rapidly changing demographics.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: In 2011, immigrants made up 7.5 percent of Italys population, more than double the percentage of just a decade before.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: That influx has combined with Italys long economic crisis in ways that have frequently confused or obfuscated the causes of the malaise, with immigrants serving as easy scapegoats.

Sentence: Kyenge - the first black person, the first immigrant - became minister in a very difficult, tense moment, said Ferruccio Pastore, director of the International and European Forum for Migration Research in Turin.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: It will be a test of the maturity of the political system, of the civil maturity of Italians.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Its an important test.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Regulators are taking a closer look at whether high-frequency trading firms might represent a threat to the stability of financial markets.
Label: Main

Sentence: The Financial Industry Regulatory Authority, an industry-financed regulator, sent letters to 10 high-speed trading firms this week, asking them for more information about their trading programs and the steps they have in place to avert market disruptions.
Label: Main

Sentence: The letter comes as regulators around the world are grappling with the role that high-speed trading firms have come to play over the last decade as they have grown to account for a majority of all trading in U.S. stocks.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: These firms, which use high-speed computers and infrastructure to take advantage of small discrepancies in trading prices, have also taken an increasing role in trading in other markets.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The letter sent out this week is focused primarily on the steps the firms take to test their programs, or algorithms, before they begin trading with them, and the preparations they take to deal with unexpected trading problems.
Label: Main

Sentence: Regulators have been focused on these issues since one trading firm, Knight Capital, lost nearly $500 million and nearly went bankrupt after its trading programs went haywire last August.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The letter also asks about efforts to monitor market manipulation. Earlier this year, FINRA said in an annual report that it was concerned about high-speed trading strategies that are used for manipulative purposes.
Label: Main

Sentence: Regulators are using new powers to crack down on a high-speed trading firm that they contend was trying to manipulate the prices of futures contracts.
Label: Main

Sentence: The Commodity Futures Trading Commission said Monday that it had set penalties of $2.8 million on Panther Energy Trading for a practice known as spoofing, in which bogus orders are used to draw in other traders.

Sentence: The agency said it was the first case to be brought using new rules against spoofing contained in the Dodd-Frank financial reform legislation.

Sentence: A number of regulatory agencies have stepped up their scrutiny of high-speed trading firms, which are coming to dominate a growing number of financial markets.

Sentence: On Friday, the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority sent letters to 10 firms asking for information about their systems and controls.

Sentence: Panther Energy Trading, based in Red Bank, N.J., engaged in the problematic practices for two months in 2011 on the Chicago Mercantile Exchanges electronic trading platform, according to the order filed by the futures commission.

Sentence: The order said the firm and Coscia used computer programs to place orders to buy futures contracts, hoping to give other traders the impression that the price of a contract was heading higher.

Sentence: NEW YORK - Fed up with what he views as a pattern of obstructionist behavior, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg has taken the rare step of filing a lawsuit against the city comptroller, John C. Liu, for rejecting two municipal contracts.
Label: Main

Sentence: The contracts would pay Aguila Inc., a company run by Robert V. Hess, Bloombergs former commissioner of homeless services, a total of $67.6 million to operate homeless shelters in the Bronx and Manhattan.

Sentence: The Manhattan shelters have long been a target of criticism from local residents and elected officials, who say, among other complaints, that the area has an excess of similar facilities.

Sentence: Liu rejected the contracts on July 3, saying they were too vague as to how many people would be offered services.

Sentence: But Bloomberg, in a lawsuit filed Thursday in state Supreme Court in Manhattan, said the courts had long held that registration of contracts was not a vehicle for the comptroller to usurp the mayors authority to enter into contracts.

Sentence: Liu, the city contends, typically asks for more technical information, then registers those contracts with few if any changes and no public notification.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Its a joke, Marc La Vorgna, Bloombergs press secretary, said of Liu.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Sad part is this is taxpayer resources and dollars being completely wasted on naked political ambitions.

Sentence: He was running for mayor the second he stepped into this job and had no interest in doing the job he was sworn in to do, only to abuse the position.

Sentence: Aides to Liu argue that the comptroller needs to highlight certain Bloomberg proposals because the mayor has mishandled contracts, like those for the CityTime payroll project and for an overhaul of the 911 system.

Sentence: In all cases, whenever this office has questioned contracts, it has been within the guidelines of the City Charter and our mandate to protect taxpayers from wasteful spending.

Sentence: In the rare cases where a mayor or a comptroller sues the other over contracts, the courts have held that comptrollers have extremely limited powers.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: In 2006, the Court of Appeals rejected former Comptroller William C. Thompson Jr.'s effort to void a contract on Snapple, writing that the Charter establishes in plain language that the mayor and the corporation counsel - not the comptroller - bear the burden of determining that procedural requirements have been met and legal authority exists to award a concession contract. (Thompson ran against Bloomberg in 2009 and is again seeking the Democratic nomination for mayor.)

Sentence: In rejecting the shelter contracts, Liu mentioned not corruption, but concerns over inspections and certificates of occupancy.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Bloomberg administration officials cited more than a half-dozen instances in recent years in which Liu publicized a rejection of a contract, then quietly registered it.

Sentence: But the reasons for rejecting the contract pertained to data input and an incomplete insurance certificate.

Sentence: Liu registered the contract that July, with minimal changes.

Sentence: When asked about the discrepancies between press statements and public documents, Hoo did not directly address the issue, but rather alluded to the mayors maneuver to run for a third term in 2009.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: It is beyond ironic that Mayor Bloombergs Law Department is up in arms about adherence to the City Charter when no one in the history of New York City has shown such deep disrespect for the City Charter, she said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: If wed followed the charter, he wouldnt even be in office right now.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The states highest court has ruled that judges have the authority to stay the sentences of so-called Dookhan defendants who are seeking new trials, upholding the legal framework created to review hundreds of cases tied to the state drug lab scandal.
Label: Main

Sentence: In a decision issued Monday, the Supreme Judicial Court ruled that the ''exceptional circumstances' surrounding convictions tied to Annie Dookhan, the former state chemist who allegedly falsified suspected drug samples, gave Superior Court judges the power to free defendants who are challenging their convictions.
Label: Main

Sentence: ''The allegations of misconduct at the Hinton drug lab have given rise to serious concerns about defendants who may be incarcerated as a consequence of tainted convictions,'' the ruling stated.
Label: Main

Sentence: ''Thus, a defendants motion to stay the execution of his sentence should be decided in an expeditious manner.''
Label: Main

Sentence: While largely procedural, the decision highlighted the swirl of legal questions surrounding Dookhan-related cases, which have flooded the judicial system and led to the release of hundreds of defendants, more than 300 from state prisons and more from county facilities.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Last fall, Essex County prosecutors contested motions to stay sentences in more than 50 cases involving allegedly tainted drug evidence, contending that the judge lacked the authority to stay sentences in the absence of a pending appeal.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The court disagreed, saying ''the interest of justice is not served by the continued imprisonment of a defendant who may be entitled to a new trial.''
Label: Main

Sentence: ''The magnitude of the allegations of serious and far-reaching misconduct by Dookhan at the Hinton drug lab cannot be overstated,'' the ruling stated.
Label: Main

Sentence: ''The alleged misconduct may have compromised thousands of cases.''
Label: Main

Sentence: Dookhan faces a host of criminal charges related to mishandling or falsifying drug evidence.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: She has pleaded not guilty.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Matthew Segal, legal director of the American Civil Liberties Union of Massachusetts, said the decision marked a ''complete rejection' of prosecutors attempt to challenge the system set up to handle the Dookhan cases.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: ''It said the exact procedure being used is fine,'' he said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The court went a step further, Segal said, in indicating that Dookhans involvement in cases may be enough to warrant a new trial.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: ''My hope is that courts will look at this opinion and see reasons for granting new trials,'' he said.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: ''You cant rest a conviction on fraud.''
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Jonathan W. Blodgett, the Essex district attorney, said the decision clarified legal and procedural questions around the special drug lab sessions, reducing the chances of further litigation.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: ''Our overriding concern was the possibility of relitigating Dookhan drug lab cases for a third time,'' he said in a statement.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: ''This would have stretched the already limited resources of all the district attorneys offices.''
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Michael OKeefe, district attorney for the Cape and Islands, said the decision would help prosecutors handle the host of legal challenges arising from the scandal, which officials have estimated could affect well over 100,000 cases.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: ''As district attorneys, our goal is to expedite the cases as quickly as possible,'' said OKeefe, president of the state association of district attorneys.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: ''In that regard, its helpful to know what the rules are.''
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: In a separate section of the ruling, the court said that special magistrates who were appointed by the Superior Court to preside over the drug lab sessions are not authorized to stay a sentence.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: But the magistrates, who by March had conducted more than 900 hearings on Dookhan-related cases, can make ''conclusions of law' for judges to review, as they have been doing.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The court also ruled that magistrates cannot overrule a Superior Court judges decision to stay a sentence.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Anne Goldbach, forensic services director in the state public defenders office, said the decision upholds the status quo.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: ''It says that the process set up to handle these cases is a valid one,'' she said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The courts decision focused on a case involving a Lynn man, Shubar Charles, who in 2010 pleaded guilty to cocaine possession with intent to distribute.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: He was sentenced to four to seven years in state prison.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Last December, he filed a motion to stay the execution of his sentence, noting that Dookhan was the primary chemist on the case.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The motion was granted, and prosecutors appealed.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: A second case involved Hector Milette, who in 2011 pleaded guilty to cocaine trafficking.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: In November, a judge denied his motion for a stayed sentence, but a special magistrate overturned the decision in February.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Prosecutors appealed, and he was sent back into custody.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: He later pleaded guilty, admitting the substance was cocaine despite Dookhans involvement, prosecutors said.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: DETROIT - A federal bankruptcy judge on Wednesday cleared the way for Detroits bankruptcy case to go forward without legal challenges.
Label: Main

Sentence: The decision by Judge Steven Rhodes of U.S. Bankruptcy Court freezes all litigation against the city during the bankruptcy process and consolidates state-level legal challenges to Detroits Chapter 9 filing into the federal bankruptcy case.
Label: Main

Sentence: The federal bankruptcy court has exclusive jurisdiction over the case, he said, adding, There is no case law that holds otherwise.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: It was a dramatic beginning to the largest municipal bankruptcy case in American history.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The judge was attempting to put to rest a legal spat that began almost immediately after Detroit filed for bankruptcy last Thursday, the largest American city ever to do so.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: On Friday a state judge, Judge Rosemarie Aquilina of Ingham County Circuit Court, ruled that the filing violated the state constitution, which protects the pensions of retired public employees.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: The city has been expected to seek reductions in pensions in bankruptcy court as part of its broader efforts to reduce Detroits estimated $18 billion in debts and other obligations.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Aquilinas ruling was appealed by the state attorney general to the Michigan Court of Appeals, which on Tuesday issued a stay of her order pending their appellate decision.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: But on Wednesday, in the first hearing on the Chapter 9 case, Rhodes approved a motion by the citys emergency financial manager, Kevyn D. Orr, to freeze all litigation against the city during the bankruptcy process.
Label: Main

Sentence: The move effectively gives Rhodes the authority to rule on the issues raised by retired public employees regarding their pensions.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: Rhodes also granted a second motion by the emergency manager that extends protection from litigation to Gov.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: Rick Snyder of Michigan and other state officials.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: Last week, Snyder accepted the citys emergency managers recommendation and ordered Detroit to file for Chapter 9.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Both Snyder and Orr have said that a bankruptcy filing was the only option to settle Detroits crushing debt.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: As the case began, protesters gathered outside the federal courthouse downtown.

Sentence: WASHINGTON - President Barack Obama on Wednesday nominated Caroline Kennedy to be ambassador to Japan, moving to give a scion of Americas most enduring political dynasty a diplomatic post that has often gone to political heavyweights.

Sentence: TUNIS, Tunisia - Tunisia, birthplace of the Arab Spring revolutionary movement, was plunged into a new political crisis Thursday when assassins shot an opposition party leader outside his home in a hail of gunfire.
Label: Main

Sentence: It was the second political assassination in Tunisia since February, and quickly incited protests blaming Ennahda, the moderate Islamist party that leads the government.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: Crowds of protesters gathered outside the offices of the Interior Ministry in Tunis, the capital, calling on Ennahda to relinquish power, and security forces were deployed to contain them.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: The Associated Press reported that protests erupted in other cities, including Sidi Bouzid, the impoverished town where the Tunisian revolution began, and in the nearby town of Meknassi, where angry demonstrators burned down the local Ennahda headquarters.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: Ennahda issued a statement calling the assassination cowardly and despicable. The leader of Ennahda, Rachid al-Ghannouchi, said on Tunisian radio: This is a crime against the democratic transition of Tunisia.

Sentence: The classic question is: Who is behind this?

Sentence: I dont think that any political party would want this.

Sentence: Other local Tunisian media said a pair of gunmen had shot Brahmi at least 11 times as he sat in a car with his daughter and that the killers escaped on a moped.

Sentence: At a hospital where Brahmis body was taken, dozens of protesters gathered to denounce Ennahda.

Sentence: Others shouted: The Islamists are vampires!

Sentence: The assassination, which coincided with celebrations for the 56th anniversary of Tunisian statehood after independence from France, came as Tunisia was still grappling with a democratic transition following the January 2011 revolution that toppled the countrys autocratic leader, Zine El Abidine Ben Ali, and forced him into exile.

Sentence: The Tunisian revolution was the catalyst that spawned similar uprisings in Egypt, Libya, Yemen and Syria.

Sentence: Mortgage Investors Corp., the beleaguered home lender run by prominent civic activist Bill Edwards, is laying off about 325 employees at its St. Petersburg headquarters, roughly a third of its workforce.

Sentence: ''We had to pull in our wings, (but) my plans are to stay in business,'' Edwards said in an interview Wednesday.

Sentence: In reality, regulators said, the company offered only adjustable rate mortgages that left customers liable for higher payments with rising interest rates.

Sentence: NEW YORK - Ronell Wilson, whose first death sentence for killing two undercover police detectives was overturned, was sentenced again Wednesday to die by a federal jury that heard gripping testimony about his time in jail, where he roamed freely after the shootings, intimidated fellow inmates and fathered a child with a guard.
Label: Main

Sentence: The anonymous jury took just five hours to reach its decision to return Wilson to federal death row, where no other New Yorker has served time in six decades.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: As the jury foreman responded to preliminary questions, Wilson, 31, slumped forward with his chin in his hands as the tension rose in the courtroom in U.S. District Court in Brooklyn.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: When the foreman finally said yes to the death penalty, Wilson looked over to his family.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: They wept as he was led away.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Rodney Andrews Sr., the father of one of the victims, Detective Rodney J. Andrews, said that he was pleased with the outcome.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Hes proven that hes not going to change, Andrews said of Wilson.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Andrews said that he wanted to watch Wilsons execution, and when asked why, he replied, For satisfaction.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The family of Detective James V. Nemorin, the other victim, did not attend court Wednesday.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: In a statement, the police commissioner, Raymond W. Kelly, said: It was an assault on the society that those officers represented, and for that reason their murders had to be answered with the full force of punishment at societys disposal.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Wilsons lawyers declined to comment.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Death penalty trials are exceedingly rare in New York, where the states highest court struck down the death penalty in 2004 and where capital cases at the federal level are often resolved before trial.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: On March 10, 2003, Wilson killed Andrews, 34, and Nemorin, 36, who were participating in a sting operation to buy an illegal gun.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: He shot each once in the back of the head at point-blank range on a secluded street on Staten Island.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Federal prosecutors vigorously sought the death penalty against Wilson, taking the case from state prosecutors when capital punishment at the state level was invalidated.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: They won a death verdict in 2007, the first one in New York since 1953.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The 2nd Circuit Court of Appeals overturned his death sentence in 2010.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The panel commuted the sentence to life in prison without parole, but prosecutors decided to again seek death.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: BEIRUT - Islamist extremists in Syrias insurgency killed 150 soldiers in a battle for control of an Aleppo suburb this week, including 51 who were executed after they had surrendered, according to a Syrian monitoring group that has been chronicling casualties and evidence of atrocities.
Label: Main

Sentence: The group, the Britain-based Syrian Observatory for Human Rights, which sympathizes with the opposition and reports daily tallies of combat and violence from a network of contacts on the ground in Syria, corroborated its assertion Friday with a video posted on the Internet.
Label: Main

Sentence: The video, dated Wednesday, showed what appeared to be an execution ground, with dozens of lifeless bodies clumped against a wall pockmarked with bullet holes.
Label: Main

Sentence: The videos authenticity could not be independently confirmed, but Rami Abdulrahman, the Syrian Observatory founder, quoted witnesses as saying 51 soldiers taken prisoner were later shot.
Label: Main

Sentence: Among the total who had surrendered, he said, very few were taken hostage.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Abdulrahman said the killers were members of the Nusra Front and Ansar al-Khalafa al-Islamiya Brigade, among the many jihadist groups, some affiliated with al-Qaida and populated with foreign fighters, that have entered Syria to join the insurgency battling the forces of President Bashar Assad in the conflict, now in its third year.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: If his assertions are confirmed, the killings would rank among the worst mass executions carried out by the rebel side and could aggravate the image problems for the coalition of insurgent forces, which are riven by internal conflict and have been losing territory to Assads side in recent weeks.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: At the United Nations on Friday, a delegation of Syrian opposition leaders met informally with Security Council members for the first time, to press their contention that Assad has no interest in negotiating a peace deal as long as he believes he is winning on the battlefield.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Delegation members told reporters they had asked Russia, the Syrian governments most powerful foreign backer, to stop supplying weapons to Assad.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The delegation, led by the coalitions newly elected president, Ahmed al-Jarba, met the day before with Secretary of State John Kerry during his visit to the United Nations and beseeched him to expedite U.S. military aid to opposition fighters.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Al-Jarba has publicly rejected any alliance with the jihadists who have joined the insurgency and has repeatedly stressed what he has called the coalitions commitment to a pluralistic democracy in Syria should the opposition prevail.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia - After years of near total dominance in Cambodian politics, the party of Prime Minister Hun Sen won a relatively narrow victory in national elections Sunday as a resurgent opposition rode a wave of disenchantment with the prime ministers 28 years in power.
Label: Main

Sentence: Khieu Kanharith, the Cambodian information minister, told news services that according to a preliminary count, the governing party won 68 seats, or about 55 percent of the National Assemblys 123 seats.
Label: Main

Sentence: In the assembly being replaced, the governing party controlled a commanding 90 seats.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: This is a historical day, a great day for Cambodia, Sam Rainsy, an opposition leader who returned from exile in France nine days before the election, told a news conference.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: People came in great numbers to express their will and democracy seemed to move forward.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The opposition won 55 seats, or about 45 percent of seats in the assembly, which will make it harder for Hun Sen to impose his will.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: After years of a splintered opposition, the election signaled the arrival, permanent or not, of a de facto two-party system in Cambodia.
Label: Main_Consequence

Sentence: The two largest opposition parties merged last year to form the Cambodia National Rescue Party.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The opposition challenged the governing party, the Cambodian Peoples Party, with a strikingly populist platform calling for a sharp rise in civil servants salaries, monthly payments to those more than 65 years old, and an increase in the minimum wage.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: It also included a guaranteed, government-set price for agriculture products, lower gasoline costs and free health care for the poor.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Hun Sens party, as well as many analysts, questioned whether the opposition would be able to pay for all the proposed measures.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: But in a country with wide income disparities, where 40 percent of children under 5 years old are malnourished and where more than two-thirds of households lack a flush toilet, the oppositions program resonated.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The opposition also highlighted corruption, land seizures and concessions of wide swaths of forest given to foreign companies, especially from China and Vietnam.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Election monitoring groups reported numerous problems with the election.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Supposedly indelible ink to prevent people from casting votes more than once, for example, was easily removed with lime juice or bleach, observers said.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: And scores of voters were turned away because their names were not found on the list, causing minor scuffles at one Phnom Penh voting station.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: NEW YORK - An administrator at a Manhattan high school admitted to having sex with four female students, according to a report by the New York City Department of Investigation.
Label: Main

Sentence: The administrator, Malik Taylor, 31, had sexual intercourse with students who ranged in age from 16 to 19, and also sexually harassed four other students while he worked as a community assistant and a dean at the high school, the Business of Sports School in Midtown, according to a report by the special commissioner of investigation for the citys schools.
Label: Main

Sentence: In an interview with investigators in June, Taylor admitted that he had had unprotected sex with students in motel rooms, in the back of his car and in classrooms after school.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: He made lewd comments about the size of students buttocks and breasts, and sent inappropriate text messages from a cellphone assigned to his wife, the report stated.
Label: Main

Sentence: He also asked one of the students to buy marijuana for him, it said.
Label: Main

Sentence: Taylor emailed his resignation to the schools principal, Joshua Solomon, in May, after one of the students told him that she had reported him.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: That student told a teacher that she was having a sexual relationship with Taylor, and that she knew of others who were as well.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: The teacher then told the schools assistant principal, Rosa Choi, who notified the special commissioners office.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: The city has referred the report to the district attorneys in Manhattan and Brooklyn for further action.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: Attempts on Tuesday evening to reach Taylor, Choi and Solomon by phone and email were unsuccessful.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: On Tuesday, the citys Education Department said that Taylors actions were completely reprehensible and that he had been barred from teaching in the city.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Taylor worked at the school for about a year, and his salary was $32,000.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: One relationship started when a student came to Taylor to discuss personal problems, the report said.
Label: Main

Sentence: It stated that Taylor began talking to her in a sexual way, and then told her he wanted her to have his child.
Label: Main

Sentence: He and another student exchanged about 6,000 text messages during a three-month period, the investigation showed.
Label: Main

Sentence: That student said Taylor groped her in the school cafeteria and made inappropriate comments to her.
Label: Main

Sentence: She eventually agreed to have sex with him at a motel after he asked her for months to be intimate with him, according to the report.
Label: Main

Sentence: Three former high-ranking Penn State officials, including the universitys former president, Graham B. Spanier, were ordered Tuesday to stand trial on charges that they were part of a cover-up related to the child sexual abuse scandal involving former football coach Jerry Sandusky.
Label: Main

Sentence: After a two-day preliminary hearing this week, Harrisburg District Judge William Werner decided there was enough evidence against Spanier, retired university vice president Gary Schultz and former athletic director Tim Curley to proceed with a trial, which could start later this year.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: That would be the next public chapter of the scandal, which threw the university and its most prominent athletic program into turmoil.
Label: Distant_Expectations_Consequences

Sentence: Two weeks ago, Penn States board of trustees authorized the payment of about $60 million to settle claims made by dozens of Sanduskys victims.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The numerous charges against the men include perjury, conspiracy and endangering the welfare of children.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: During the preliminary hearing, prosecutors accused the men of knowing of abuse allegations against Sandusky but failing to properly report them.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: They are also accused of hiding information from investigators and lying to a grand jury.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: The allegations stem from an incident in 2001, in which former Penn State assistant coach Mike McQueary said he saw Sandusky molesting a boy in a university shower.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: At Sanduskys trial, McQueary testified that he reported the incident to Joe Paterno - Penn States famed former coach - Curley and Schultz.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: Curley and Schultz have said McQueary did not make it clear the act was sexual in nature.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Spanier denied knowing the full nature of the incident.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: But emails between the three men revealed that Spanier, Curley and Schultz had decided in 2001 to confront Sandusky themselves, instead of reporting the allegations.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The only downside for us is if the message isnt 'heard and acted upon, and we then become vulnerable for not having reported it, Spanier wrote at the time.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: The emails also included discussion of abuse allegations against Sandusky from 1998.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Spanier had testified to a grand jury that he had not been aware of the 1998 allegations.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: McQueary testified this week that Paterno had told him that the university botched its response to the Sandusky scandal and warned him that he would be made the scapegoat.
Label: Cause_Specific

Sentence: McQueary said Paterno told him, Old Main screwed up, referencing the landmark campus building that houses the offices of the president and other administrators.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: LOS ANGELES - A year after Daniel Chong, a San Diego college student, was found hallucinating and suffering from kidney failure inside a Drug Enforcement Administration holding cell where he had been accidentally left for four days, the agency has agreed to compensate him for his ordeal.
Label: Main

Sentence: The federal government has agreed to pay Chong $4.1 million, Julia Yoo, one of his lawyers, said this week.
Label: Main

Sentence: Chongs lawyers filed a legal claim seeking $20 million last year.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: It was an accident, Chong, now 25, said at a news conference Tuesday to announce the settlement, a really, really bad, terrible accident.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Chong was picked up last year during a raid on his friends house, where he and some friends had gathered to smoke marijuana.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: Chong, a student at the University of California, San Diego, and the other suspects were taken to DEA offices, where he was interviewed.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Agents told Chong that he would be released, he said, and he was taken to a holding cell to wait for what he was told would be a few minutes.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Instead, he was forgotten inside the cell for four days.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Without food or water, he drank his own urine, contemplated taking his own life and tried to scratch a goodbye note to his mother into his arm.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: When agents found him on the fifth day, he thought he might be minutes from death.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: He spent several days in a hospital intensive care unit, where he was treated for severe dehydration and kidney failure.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: Over the past year, his lawyers said, he has continued to suffer from post-traumatic stress disorder.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: His doctor said this was one of the worst cases of stress he had ever seen, Eugene G. Iredale, one of Chongs lawyers, said in an interview Wednesday.
Label: Distant_Evaluation

Sentence: The DEA issued an apology shortly after Chong was found in the cell.
Label: Distant_Historical

Sentence: A spokeswoman for the agency Wednesday refused to comment on the settlement but confirmed that the detention policies had been changed.
Label: Cause_General

Sentence: The Office of the Inspector General in the Justice Department was reviewing the case.
Label: Cause_General
